title: Broadridge Technology Internship - Summer 2025
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
Are you a sharp, technology-minded student looking to gain invaluable experience in the rapidly growing financial technology sector? Broadridge is recruiting for high-potential students to join our team for an exciting and enriching summer internship program.
Why Broadridge?
At Broadridge, we are dedicated to fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation. Our summer internship program will immerse you in this dynamic environment, providing you with numerous opportunities for growth and learning.
Opportunities may be available, but are not limited to the below areas:* Software Engineering
* Infrastructure Engineering
* Development Operations
* Technology Business Management and Project Management
* Enterprise Systems Management


From day one, summer interns are immersed in Broadridge’s innovative and dynamic company culture as they receive:* Immersive orientation program combined with ongoing an executive speaker series and professional development curriculum designed specifically for summer interns
* Meaningful and challenging work assignments that deliver learning and skill development through practical work, mentorship, and training
* Exposure to different areas of business throughout the organization
* Comprehensive professional etiquette and financial services fundamentals training, along with technical and business acumen development
* During the program, your daily responsibilities will vary based on your job profile and team assignment.


We are made up of high performing teams that meet in person to learn and collaborate as needed. During your time in the program, you will be assigned to one of our Tri-State area offices. Final assignment is based on placement.
Apply now to kickstart your journey in the FinTech world with Broadridge!
Qualifications* Currently pursuing a BA/BS Degree in Engineering, Technology, Computer Science or other related area with a graduation date of December 2025 through Spring 2027 from an accredited University
* Minimum cumulative GPA of a 3.0 or higher
* Demonstrated leadership experience
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; the ability to promote teamwork and collaboration
* Interest and a real passion for learning about the FinTech industry
* Must be available for the full duration of the program (June 2nd, 2025-August 8th, 2025) to be eligible to participate


Compensation Range: $28 - $38 per hour.*Broadridge considers various factors when evaluating a candidate's final salary including, but not limited to, relevant experience, skills, and education*
Additional Information:* *Candidates who meet our initial qualifications will be contacted for a video interview with our recruitment team as a first step in our interview process.*
* *Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and will close on* *Friday, December 13th 2024 (11:59 PM EST) Please note application may close once the program reaches capacity.*

  

Broadridge associates helped us envision our Connected Workplace - a work model that allows associates around the globe, dependent upon their role responsibilities, to take advantage of the benefits of both on-site and off-site work to support our clients, one another, and the communities where we live and work. Our Connected Workplace is grounded in the concept of FACS: Flexible, Accountable, Connected, and Supported, which is our commitment to our associates. FACS supports our strong culture and allows us to achieve business goals while supporting meaningful work-life integration for our associates.  

  

We are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment and committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates can only do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates diversity in all its dimensions.*Disability Assistance*
We recognize that ensuring our long-term success means creating an environment where everyone is welcome, where everyone's strengths are valued, and where everyone can perform at their best. Broadridge provides equal employment opportunities to all associates and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, and pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ethnic origin, age, disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, and other protected characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. US applicants: Click here to view the "EEO is the Law" poster.
If you need assistance or would like to request reasonable accommodations during the application and/or hiring process, please contact us at 888-237-7769 or by sending an email to BRcareers@broadridge.com.

title: Group Leader
description:
**Job Opening:**  
Group Leader

New York City Mission Society improves the lives of children, youth, and families in the city’s most underserved communities. Through programs and services that respond to community needs, we create cycles of success for generations to come.

**Position Summary**  
**Title:** Group Leader

**Program:** Power Academy

**Reports To:** Program Director

**Supervises:**

**Employment Status:** Part-Time Non

**Basic Function:** Facilitate implementation of program activities for a group of elementary school-aged after-school participants while creating a nurturing environment that fosters the creativity and educational advancement of the children.

**Duties and Responsibilities** 

* Create a supportive and nurturing group environment for students.
* Accountable for the safety and well-being of students at all times.
* Supervise and monitor students during all program activities and transitions on-site and off-site.
* Facilitate academic enrichment programming for students in a group setting.
* Provide age-appropriate activities according to each site’s program activity schedule.
* Provide one-on-one homework help.
* Develop and implement lesson plans.
* Prepare materials and hand-outs for lessons.
* Keep accurate records on attendance, sign-out, accidents, and incident reports.
* Create and coordinate student performances as needed.
* Attend team and group supervision meetings.
* Interact with and report to parents on a daily basis at dismissal.
* Establish good working relationships with youth workers and other program staff and members of the school staff and leadership team.
* Attend professional development trainings as required by the agency and program contract.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**

* Minimum Associate’s Degree in a related field or two years of experience working with students (elementary or middle-school aged) required.
* Must have strong interest in working with children.
* Must have the ability to work collaboratively with a wide range of program and school staff.
* Must have excellent communication (written and verbal), interpersonal, organizational, and administrative skills.
* Experience overseeing a group of young people required.
* Experience creating lesson plans preferred.

**General Requirements**: Staff is expected to be committed to the mission, vision, and values of Mission Society.

**Salary and Benefits:** Hourly wage between $19.25 per hour, based on qualifications, experience, and fit.

Note: We are unable to accept phone calls. Applicants must meet qualifications stated above.

Only applicants selected for further consideration will be contacted.

*Mission Society of New York City is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $19.25 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Bakery Clerk
description:
Prepare or serve hot or cold beverages, such as coffee, espresso drinks, blended coffees, or teas.

Clean or sanitize work areas, utensils, or equipment.

Check temperatures of freezers, refrigerators, or heating equipment to ensure proper functioning.Describe menu items to customers or suggest products that might appeal to them.

Order, receive, or stock supplies or retail products Provide customers with product details, such as coffee blend or preparation descriptions.

title: Social Media Coordinator
description:
\\*Job Overview\\*

We are seeking a creative and detail-oriented Social Media Coordinator to join our team. The ideal candidate will be passionate about digital marketing and have a strong understanding of social media platforms.

\\*Responsibilities\\*

- Develop and implement social media strategies to increase brand awareness

- Build and implement social media calendar

- Create engaging content for various social media platforms including IG, Facebook, TikTok, LinkedIn, Pinterest and others as we see fit

- Monitor social media channels and engage with followers

- Conduct research to stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices

- Collaborate with the stakeholders to ensure consistency in branding

- Utilize SEO techniques to optimize social media content

- Capture and edit high-quality photos and videos for social media posts

- Assist with email marketing initiatives

- Utilize social listening tools to track brand mentions and sentiment

- Support web initiatives by creating content for online platforms

\\*Qualifications\\*

- Proven experience in digital marketing and social media management

- Strong knowledge of SEO, content creation, and digital marketing strategies

- Proficiency in photography and videography as well as editing software

- Familiarity with email marketing platforms and strategies

- Ability to create compelling content that aligns with the brand's identity

- Experience in brand building, stigmatizing, and maintaining a consistent brand voice across platforms

- Excellent communication skills and attention to detail

- Ability to analyze data and draw meaningful insights from social media metrics

If you are a social media enthusiast with a passion for creating engaging content and driving brand visibility, we invite you to apply for the Social Media Coordinator position.

Expected hours: 5 – 12 per week

* Receive and process payments (cash and credit cards)
* Keep the drink station area clean
* Keep customer area clean
* Maintain stock of all consumables used in the front of the house
* Comply with health and safety regulations

Previous experience in POS, customer service, and bakery/coffee industry experience is definitely a plus but never required. We will provide paid training! Looking for someone who can show up to work on time, willing to work/learn and respectful!

title: Director of Nursing
company: Partnership for Maternal & Child Health of Northern New Jersey
description:
\\*Signing Bonus\\*

Work within the local community and lead agency structure to ensure that the Family Connects NJ program for postpartum nursing home visits is implemented in accordance with established guidelines, model fidelity, and contract requirements. Provide oversight to the Family Connects NJ Program in Essex and Sussex catchment areas. Provide support to other public health programs, including immunization programs.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES:

* Provide direct supervision and evaluation of nurse supervisors and management staff.
* Participate in the Family Connects International model required training and participate in ongoing training webinars and professional development trainings. Ensure the Family Connects programs are operated with fidelity to the FCI model.
* Identify ongoing professional development needs and opportunities for nurse supervisors and nurse home visitors.
* Perform Quality Assurance assessments of the program and support supervisors in continuous quality improvement implementation.
* Lead Monthly Quality Assurance meetings with internal and external stakeholders.
* Develop and maintain community and provider referral sources for the program, along with nurse supervisors and support staff. Present to clinical and community partners about the program to increase awareness of the program.
* Actively participate in preparation and monitoring of program budgets to ensure appropriate use of funds. Track spending and report on inventory of nursing supplies quarterly.
* Ensure timely and accurate data input and utilization of web-based data systems for nursing documentation.
* Effectively support nurse supervisors in analyzing complex problems and clinical case situations and consult with Medical Director as needed for clinical guidance.
* Support coordination and collaboration with internal and external public health programs.
* Evaluate implementing agency outcomes and interventions.
* Prepare and submit program progress reports.
* Handles other assignments as requested.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

* Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing required
* Current NJ RN license *(in good standing)*
* BLS certification
* Required 5-8 years of experience providing maternal/child health service in community setting, home visitation, OB-GYN nursing, neonatal and/or pediatric nursing, labor and delivery, adult mental health, or closely related field.
* Required 2-3 years of program management/supervision experience.
* Experience working with diverse populations, communities, and organizations.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Computer proficiency in MS Office Suite
* Highly collaborative styles, skilled at relationship and consensus building
* Strong initiative and follow through with enthusiastic positive attitude
* Ability to work collaboratively with various agencies and stakeholders

***All PMCH employees must comply with the guidelines of PMCH's Immunization Policy.***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $108,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

title: Client Success Manager, Agency
description:
The Opportunity:
We are looking for a dedicated Client Success Manager, Agency to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring that our clients fully realize the value of our products by fostering product adoption and retention. The successful candidate will work closely with Client Partners and internal teams to deliver the full value of Shutterstock’s offerings to our accounts.
The Day to Day:* Act as the main point of contact for clients post-sale, ensuring they receive maximum value from our products and services.
* Monitor and drive adoption of assigned accounts, providing basic technical support and ensuring a high level of client satisfaction.
* Proactively manage customer accounts by establishing a consistent cadence of client interactions, including status reviews, question and answer sessions, and guidance on getting the most from our products.
* Identify potential barriers to renewal and work with clients to overcome these, ensuring a high rate of retention.
* Utilize analytical abilities to identify opportunities and drive data-informed actions, enhancing overall customer success.
* Escalate technical and service issues to the appropriate internal teams, ensuring prompt and reliable resolution.
* Recognize opportunities for account growth through upselling or cross-selling and communicate these opportunities to the Client Partner.
* Maintain detailed records of client interactions, issues, and account growth opportunities within the Shutterstock CRM system.
* Collaborate with the sales, marketing, and product teams to align client success strategies with broader company goals.
* Gather client feedback to inform and influence product development and company service offerings.


What you’ll Bring to the Role:* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in a client success, account management, or customer service role in a technology or SaaS company.
* Proven track record of maintaining high customer satisfaction and retention rates.
* Experience providing technical support and resolving client issues.
* Proficient in CRM software, preferably with hands-on experience in Salesforce or a similar platform.
* Demonstrated ability to understand and articulate technical concepts and derive solutions.
* Experience in identifying upsell and cross-sell opportunities within a customer success framework.
* A proactive and empathetic professional with a passion for driving customer success and building long-term relationships.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
* Strong problem-solving skills with a knack for identifying solutions that address client needs.
* Ability to manage time effectively, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Team player with a collaborative spirit, but also able to work independently.


 Why Shutterstock:* You have a direct impact on the success of the company. Your team’s work matters and is essential to the evolution of our core business!
* Executive leadership cares personally. They prioritize growth and planning your career path with your goals and passions in mind.
* Flexibility to work between home and office with everything you need to be successful in both
* A generous and competitive benefits package.


Shutterstock connects diverse artists and creative professionals around the globe with the agencies, brands and people who need their work and services. It’s a place where creators come to be inspired and discover new ways to produce their best work.
Shutterstock enables its employees to drive culture and tap into the world around them to develop the toolbox and solutions that help others share their world views. At Shutterstock, your ideas will be welcomed, your uniqueness will be celebrated, and you will be supported in presenting your view of the world as you experience it. We’re champions of resiliency; quickly learning from our shortcomings in our pursuit of continuous growth.
Diverse teams are critical to our success. We encourage people from different backgrounds to apply and we commit to creating and maintaining a culture where employees know they belong and have equal opportunities to succeed.
At Shutterstock, we are committed to providing competitive pay and benefits that are in line with industry standards. The compensation package offered may vary depending on employment experience, skills, and knowledge. You may also be eligible for our generous benefits package including health, wellness and financial benefits. Compensation ranges for candidates in locations outside of the location(s) below may differ based on the cost of labor, market, and additional factors.
#LI-Hybrid  

#LI-ES1

Shutterstock Values
We are one team collectively focused on creating an unrivaled experience for our Customers and Contributors. Our Values represent the mindset of the employee who will thrive at Shutterstock. title: Home Health Aide HHA
description:
**Home Health Aide HHA**  

Somerset County  

  

**Company Overview:**  

  

Alvita Care is a mission-driven Home Healthcare & Personal Care Agency with four branches and over 500 caregivers. We provide relief and assurance to family members in the areas of In-Home Personal Care, Alzheimer's & Dementia Care, Palliative & Hospice Care, and Geriatric Care Management and have earned The Joint Commission Gold Seal of Approval. Alvita Care clients are all private-pay and we do not accept Medicare or Medicaid.  

  

It is our mission to ensure our clients are happy, safe, well cared for, and above all treated with dignity and respect. Alvita is unique in its focus on the entire family unit, not just the senior with whose care we are entrusted. In addition, we differentiate ourselves from competitors through 24/7 availability (never through an answering service), guaranteed compatibility between client and caregiver, and RN oversite on every case.  

  

Alvita is searching for compassionate and reliable certified Home Health Aides throughout both New York and New Jersey. Numerous client locations available making for an easy commute.  

  

**Details:**
* Weekly paycheck on Fridays (direct deposit, debit pay card or paper check)
* Medical / health benefits available\\*
* Sick time – up to 56 hours per year of sick time per year based on hours worked
* 401(k) with company match \\*\\*
* Fast on-boarding process to get you working ASAP
* $250 HHA referral bonuses available!

**If you are interested or curious about any job details, please apply or reach out directly to Stephanie Tomkowich by calling 212-256-8285 or emailing stephanie.tomkowich@alvitacare.com!**  

**Tasks & Duties:**
* ADL's: Activities of Daily Living
* IADL's: Instrumental Activities of Daily Living
* Possible RN delegation of activities

**Qualifications:**
* Must have valid HHA / PCA certificate
* Must have updated medicals/vaccinations or be willing to obtain
* Completed drug screen or completed Habituation Form

  

  

  

* subject to one-year employment and 1,560 hours worked (30 hours / week average)


\\*\\* - subject to one-year employment and 1,000 hours worked (20 hours/ week average)  

  

Hi  

Alvita Care is currently hiring PCAs/HHAs in your area.  

If you would like to discuss the potential opportunity call Stephanie @ 212.256.8285, stephanie.tomkowich@alvitacare.com  

  

Thank you.

title: Compliance Manager
description:
This position is responsible for developing consistent, scalable business processes that reduce transaction costs, improve quality, enhance productivity and drive excellent internal and external customer service.

This role...

* Drives efficient flow of work throughput, with emphasis on cost improvement, cycle time (service) and production time reduction.
* Provides in-service training on how to use NET service effectively.
* Provides outreach regarding members, transportation, education and other subjects as needed to medical facilities.
* Provides guidance support for all exceptions process related questions.
* Provides guidance on the research and resolution to work that requires further actions.
* Manages the denial and appeal process within the department.
* Manages the department's phone activity (inbound and outbound) for quality and efficiency.
* Provides guidance on utilization investigations.
* May lead projects and perform other duties as assigned.
* Occasional business travel may be required.
* Determines appropriate resourcing of staff in order to achieve goals and objectives.
* Defines annual Key Performance Indicators aligned with corporate goals.
* Manages and mentors employees on performance gaps, career development opportunities, and strategies.
* Manages and coaches employees on all human resource related processes including onboarding, performance management, succession planning, employee relations, selection, terminations, compensation and rewards.
* Recognizes others’ contributions and share credit for success.
* Owns attainment of high employee satisfaction and retention; lead development of program and initiatives within group to attain high employee satisfaction.
* Prepares and manages budget as assigned; analyzes variances and initiates corrective actions to maximize operational performance.

We are excited to speak to individuals with the following...

* Bachelor's Degree required.
* Six (6) plus years experience.
* Two (2) plus years leadership responsibility.
* Or equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
* Excellent customer service and people skills.
* Ability to work independently or with a team.
* Ability to quickly learn new technology and processes.
* Ability to understand and follow complex instructions.
* Ability to read, write, and understand English fluently.
* Demonstrated ability to lead and positively influence a team.
* Ability to deliver clear, effective, and engaging oral presentations to a public audience.
* Proficient in Microsoft Suite products such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
* Excellent problem-solving skills; must be able to develop and implement action plans to address issues.

Pay: $52,900 - $71,400 annual

This role is bonus eligible based on individual and company performance

Pay: $52,900.00 - $71,400.00 per year

* 401(k) matching
* Health insurance

* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

* Moving about the public areas
* Handling objects such as luggage
* Bending, stooping, kneeling


Other:

* Reading and writing abilities are utilized often when completing departmental records/logs, reading road signs, etc..
* May be required to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays.

title: Quality Specialist
description:
Position Summary:  
The Quality Specialist supports the Business Units, by attending Daily Operational Review (DOR), supporting Local Management of Change (MOC), Quality Monitoring System (QMS) review and implementation, Non-Conformance Investigations, \\*\\*\\* Continuous Excellence (NCE) support throughout the factory, and other quality tasks as needed.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBLITIES:

* Quality Control Activities – Supports the Business Units and the other QA specialists by attending the Business Unit Daily Operational Review. Takes part in investigations to drive issues impacting Quality KPIs under the guidance of BU Supervisor and Site QA Manager. Supports training for key business unit team members to ensure that the proper knowledge base is present. Supports the annual QMS review to assure documentation alignment to practices including updating & maintaining DMO-MMS system.
* Quality System – Support and update quality procedures, work instructions and tools for the Business unit. Support Management of Change (MOC) by ensuring program compliance and audit readiness. Support operational objectives in collaboration with the QA leadership team.
* Quality Auditing and Verification – Support Business Unit readiness for internal and external audits.
* Quality Guardianship – Notify appropriate production personnel/management of deviations, non-conformances and blocked product.
* People and Know-How – Support Production in the achievement of their objectives. Promote quality awareness and commitment to quality across the facility through effective training and coaching of the QMS (DMO-MMS) and quality standards.
* Quality Mastership – Support \\*\\*\\* Continuous Excellence program in the quest for zero defect. Support activities to achieve compliance with \\*\\*\\* Quality Management System requirements and other applicable instructions and standards. Identify non-conformance issues and take part in Quality/Food Safety risk analysis (QMS & HACCP), support investigations (GSTD), to recommend proper disposition of associated product.
* Providing support to other quality systems within the plant as assigned.

Safety and Environmental:

* Follow factory safety & environmental objectives & targets
* Follow the plant safety rules; report incidents & unsafe conditions immediately
* Maintain compliance with regulations, and refer to the Safety & Environmental Management System(s) on all related procedures and programs.
* Understand the environmental aspects of the position and take action to reduce these environmental impacts by conserving paper, electricity, water etc. Will also recycle all appropriate materials (paper, plastic, food, etc.)

Quality:

* Follow factory food safety, quality objectives & targets
* Follow \\*\\*\\* Good Manufacturing Practices; report food safety and quality issues immediately.
* Maintain compliance with regulations, and refer to \\*\\*\\* Quality Management System on all related procedures and programs.
* Understand the food safety and quality aspects of the position as indicated on QMS, OJT's and SOP's that apply.

Throughout all of these responsibilities, maintains a focus on continuous improvement.

**EXPERIENCE:**  
- Bachelors Degree preferred (microbiology, chemistry or food science).  
- Exposure to different jobs within the Business unit (production, maintenance) or within Quality.  
- Minimum of 2 years of related Quality experience  
- Different exposure (e.g. Mission, Special Projects etc).

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $26.81 - $30.79 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Quality Control: 1 year (Preferred)
* Food industry: 1 year (Preferred)
* Good Manufacturing Practices: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Bridgewater, NJ (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Bridgewater, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Monitor Technician
description:
**Position Summary**
====================

The Monitoring Technician is responsible for on-going surveillance of patient cardiac monitors and provides RNs and/or clinicians with immediate notification of any changes in cardiac rhythms. Measures and interprets patients' heart rhythm and documents on patient record per departmental standards. Initiates and discontinues monitoring equipment on admission, tr


ansfer, or discharge. Performs clerical duties related to admission, discharge, and documentation of patient information from Central Telemetry.


**Essential Functions and Responsibilities Includes the****Following:**
=======================================================================

1. Understands and adheres to the WPH Performance Standards, Policies and Behaviors.
2. Performs tasks listed in job summary according to policy and procedure.
3. Integrates patient's rights into work practice.
4. Utilizes current methods of infection control.
5. Participates in Performance Improvement Initiatives.
6. Utilizes appropriate steps in the decision making process to include recognition and priority setting related to patient care and unit based issues.
7. Collaborates and communicates with the health care team.
8. Completes competency requirements.
9. Attends mandatory inservices.
10. Attends staff meetings as required/ requested.
11. Utilizes cost containment practices.
12. Adheres to all WPHC policies and procedures including dress code, code of conduct, customer service, attendance and submission of annual physical.
13. Performs all other related duties as assigned.  


**Education & Experience****Requirements**
==========================================

* High school diploma or GED.

  


* Successful completion of WPH 4 Day EKG course and EKG exam prior to completion of orientation.

  


* Possess and maintain current certification in American Heart Association Basic Life Support (BLS) for Health care Providers (must be completed during orientation).

  


**Core****Competencies**
========================

* Teamwork & Adaptability


* Acts as a Professional Role Model


* Excellent Communication Skills (both verbal and written)


* Attention to Detail


* Planning & Organizing


* Sound Problem-Solving, Judgment and Decision-Making Skills


* Stress Tolerance

  


**Physical/Mental Demands/Requirements & Work****Environment**
==============================================================

  


  

* May be exposed to chemicals necessary to perform required tasks. Any hazardous chemicals the employee may be exposed to are listed in the hospital's SDS (Safety Data Sheet) data base and may be accessed through the hospital's Intranet site (Employee Tools/SDS Access). A copy of the SDS data base can also be found at the hospital switchboard, saved on a disc.


* Must be physically able to frequently push/ pull/ lift heavy objects more than 50 lbs and lift patients of all weights with a minimum of one (1) assist or assistive device; perform difficult manipulative, arm – hand steadiness and hand –eye coordination skills; walk and stand for prolonged periods of time.


* Must have the ability to concentrate on fine detail with interruption and attend to tasks for more than 60 minutes at a time.

  


**Primary Population****Served**
================================

  

Check appropriate box(s) below:  


?Neonatal (birth – 28 days)  

?Patients with exceptional communication needs  

  

?Infant (29 days – less than 1 year)  

?Patients with developmental delays  

  

?Pediatric (1 – 12 years)  

?Patients at end of life  

  

?Adolescent (13 – 17 years)  

?Patients under isolation precautions  

  

?Adult (18 – 64 years)  

?Patients with cultural needs  

  

?Geriatric (> 65 years)  

?All populations  

  

?Bariatric Patients with weight related comorbidities  

? Non-patient care population  

  

Salary Range: $40,836.90-$61,255.16 (Ranges based on Full Time Hours)

  

Location: White Plains Hospital · Nursing 4F CCU Stepdown  

Schedule: Per Diem, Night, Mon-Fri, 7pm-7am two shifts every 4 weeks, some weekends and holidays
company_description: White Plains Hospital is a proud member of the Montefiore Health System, serving as its tertiary hub of advanced care in the Hudson Valley.

title: Director of Patient Services ( DPS )
description:
We are on the lookout for a dedicated and compassionate Director of Patient Services to join our dynamic home care agency team. Our home care agency is committed to providing quality in-home care services that make a real difference in the lives of those we serve.

The Director of Patient Services will oversee the implementation and delivery of all our patient care services. This includes managing the nursing and caregiver staff, coordinating patient care with families and healthcare providers, and ensuring compliance with all state and federal regulations. Your role will be pivotal in maintaining the excellence of our care standards and fostering a supportive environment for both staff and clients.

**Key Responsibilities:**  
- Lead and manage our team of nurses and caregivers, promoting a culture of compassion, professionalism, and excellence.  
- Oversee patient care plans, ensuring they meet both the clients' health needs and personal preferences.  
- Ensure compliance with all healthcare regulations, policies, and best practices.  
- Collaborate with healthcare professionals and family members to provide holistic and comprehensive care.  
- Conduct regular staff training and development programs to enhance service delivery and patient care skills.  
- Monitor and manage patient feedback to continuously improve care quality and client satisfaction.

**Qualifications:**  
- Valid nursing license and a bachelor’s degree in Nursing (Master’s preferred).  
- Strong leadership skills, with a proven track record of managing teams effectively.

- Experience in Home Care preferred but not necessary

- Training skills

If you are passionate about leading a team that makes a real difference in people’s lives, we would love to hear from you.  
Join us in our mission to deliver unparalleled home care services and improve the quality of life for our clients. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

License/Certification:

* RN License (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Sales Executive RMW
description:
**About Us:**
-------------


Stericycle is a U.S. based business-to-business services company and leading provider of compliance-based solutions that protects people and brands, promotes health and well-being, and safeguards the environment. Since our founding over 30 years ago, we have grown from a small start-up in medical waste management into a leader across a range of increasingly complex and highly regulated arenas, serving healthcare organizations and commercial businesses of every size. Every day, we help our customers solve complex challenges by safely managing materials that could otherwise spread disease, contaminate the environment, or compromise one’s identity.


Join us on our mission to protect health and well-being in a safe, responsible, and sustainable way.

**Position Purpose:**
---------------------


Secures new business/new logos by selling Regulated Medical Waste, and Compliance service solutions. Responsible for growing revenue and profitability in assigned geographic area by selling Regulated Medical Waste and Compliance Services (OSHA/HIPAA)services., while meeting or exceeding established annual goals.

**Key Job Activities:**
-----------------------

* Call blocks to non-acute healthcare facilities to schedule on-site appoints throughout the week to demonstrate our capabilities in Compliance. Demonstrates ability to build and maintain a strong pipeline.
* Strong prospecting and business development skills to achieve new business and sells regulated medical waste, OSHA and HIPAA Compliance solutions by demonstrating comprehensive knowledge of our products and services, as well as, the value proposition for customers. Result oriented with a sense of urgency.
* Sells regulated medical waste, OSHA and HIPAA Compliance to previous Stericycle customers to win back lost business, by demonstrating our capabilities and selling to the customers’ needs of their business by demonstrating communication, negotiation and presentation skills.
* Builds and sustains strong, trusting relationships with new and previously existing customers leveraging the face to face experience with a local subject matter expert and growing that business over the future with additional services to meet the customers’ needs. Motivated by success.
* Follows up on targeted marketing campaigns to grow business in geography leveraging our services to meet customers’ needs.
* Participate in market development activities by identifying areas/market within territory that are under-developed, and implementing initiatives to increase market penetration and increase sales through new sales initiatives.

***The Sales Executive will cover Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and Long Island as their territory. Sales Executive must reside within or adjacent to the territory.***

**Education:**
--------------


Required Education: in Bachelors or Equivalent**Experience (North America & LATAM):**
---------------------------------------

* Minimum of 2-3 years of field/outside sales experience is highly preferred
* Experience selling in a **business-to-business** environment involving varying sales cycles and multiple levels of decision makers is highly preferred
* Experience in a high volume / high transaction industry is highly preferred
* Post-secondary education (College or University Degree) is strongly desired
* Experience using Salesforce or other similar CRM and SAP is an advantage but not required.
* Demonstrated ability to build and maintain a strong sales pipeline
* Strong prospecting and business development skills
* Demonstrated expertise in initiating and managing successful business-to-business sales and service relationships
* Strong and polished professional communication skills, negotiating abilities and excellent phone etiquette
* Strong presentation, communication and negotiation skills
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, CRM systems and internet/social media
* Results oriented with a sense of urgency; motivated by success
* Able and prepared to travel within a defined, local territory on a daily basis; minimal long distance travel is required.
* Valid Driver License and driving record within MVR guidelines.
* **Pursuant to New York City salary posting requirements, Base Salary $65k-70k OTE- $180k+. Un-capped commission.**
**Benefits:**
-------------


Stericycle currently offers its employees the option to participate in a full range of benefits, including a health care program which includes medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage, healthcare and dependent care flexible spending accounts, life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance, an employee assistance program, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation and sick time, a 401(k) plan, and an employee stock purchase plan. Participation in some programs requires that employees be regularly scheduled to work a minimum number of hours and/or to have fulfilled a waiting period after they begin employment with Stericycle.

**Our Promise:**
----------------


Stericycle is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce, and to valuing unique perspectives and identities. We foster a culture of belonging that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our team members. It fuels our innovation and strengthens our connection to our customers and the communities we serve. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.***Disclaimer:***
-----------------

*The above description is meant to provide a summary of the nature and level of work being performed; it should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and requirements of the job. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, and it does not constitute any right or guarantee of employment condition. This position is open to people with disabilities. Stericycle will consider requests for workplace accommodations for protected physical or mental limitations in accordance with its human resources and risks prevention policies and local laws. To the extent permissible under local law, and consistent with business necessity, Stericycle reserves the right to modify the content formally or informally, either verbally or in writing, at any time with or without advance notice.* *#Ll-CC1*
company_description: At Stericycle, we deliver solutions and drive innovations that protect the environment, people, and public health. This includes working to create a more sustainable and shared future.

title: Club Manager - Passaic
description:
**Job Overview:**



We are looking for a Club Manager who can lead and inspire a team. This person will focus on anticipating and exceeding the members’ expectations by providing an unparalleled member experience. The Club Manager will continue to train and develop the team to ensure they embody the qualities of a Moodlifter; warm greetings, up-beat and positive energy, engages with members and prospects alike. The Club Manager will also ensure all policies and procedures are consistently followed.


**Responsibilities:**


* Build a winning team of Moodlifters through hiring, training, motivating, coaching and evaluating staff.
* Drive member count and ancillary business revenue to ensure the club is meeting and exceeding their targets.
* Partner with the Personal Training teams to guarantee a fully staffed team of productive trainers who are meeting and exceeding their targets.
* Spend time on the floor and at the front desk make sure we are delivering an exceptional member experience.
* Walk the floor of the club regularly to evaluate the cleanliness of the facility.
* Manage the payroll and supply expenses to ensure the club is within the budgets provided.
* Drive the sales of the retail and food and beverage product.


**Qualifications:**


* Proven leadership ability in an educational, fitness or professional setting.
* Minimum two (2) years management experience in a customer service business (Preferably Retail or Fitness)
* Proven ability to hire, direct and train staff.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Possess honesty and personal integrity.
* Be enthusiastic, energetic and personable.
* Passionate, intelligent and knowledgeable regarding the service and fitness industry.
* Computer literate.
* Hardworking and diligent.
* Excellent time management, organizational, problem solving and follow-up skills.


**Compensation & Benefits****:**


* Pay Transparency: Min $18 – Max $22.50, ability to earn additional incentive bonuses
* Complimentary Blink membership
* Comprehensive benefits package
* And more


**Company Overview****:**



Founded in 2011 by executives at Equinox, Blink Fitness is a premium quality, value-based fitness brand with more than 90 locations open or in development throughout New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and California. Blink puts Mood Above Muscle™, which celebrates the positive feeling you get from exercise, not just the physical benefits. Blink is an exciting and dynamic business that is still in the start-up mode. We are a passionate team with a great entrepreneurial spirit and a willingness to roll up our sleeves to get the work done.



 For more information visit Blink’s consumer website - blinkfitness.com – and its franchise website – blinkfranchising.com.
company_addresses: 386 Park Avenue South, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10016
company_description: At Blink, we’re a fitness family on a mission to bring all the benefits of exercise to as many people as possible. It’s like we always say:

title: HVA Group Leader
description:
Founded in 1812, NYC Mission Society is in its third century of providing programs and services to youth in underserved communities. Today, our educational, cultural enrichment, and workforce development programs make a positive, long-term impact on youth in the City’s most underserved communities by promoting academic achievement and providing career opportunities. Each year, we serve more than 2,000 children and families throughout New York City with our programs, supportive services, and community events. New York City Mission Society helps children, youth, and families in New York City’s poorest neighborhoods transcend the ills of poverty and create a cycle of success for generations to come. We have a dynamic portfolio of education, workforce development, prevention, and youth development and community-building programs.

Title:Group Leader, After-School Program

Basic Function: Facilitate implementation of program activities for a group of middle school-aged after-school program participants while creating a nurturing environment that fosters the creativity and educational advancement of the children.

Location: Harlem Village Academy – 244 W. 144th Street New York, NY 10030

Hours: Part-time: 17 hours per week (Monday – Thursday, 3:15-6pm, Friday, 12-6pm)

Program Description:The Mission Society’s Power Academy is an after-school program dedicated to cultivating the personal growth and educational advancement of all 6th to 8th grade participants. With a curriculum focused on academic enrichment, community service, cultural enrichment, the arts, recreation, and character education, the Power Academy will reinforce school-day learning in a safe and healthy environment. **(This position is Fully In-Person and begins September 2024)**

Principal Responsibilities:

· Create a supportive and nurturing environment for students.

* Accountable for the safety and well-being of students at all times.

· Supervise and monitor students during all program activities/trips and transitions on-site and off-site.

* Develop and provide age-appropriate activities according to the program activity schedule.
* Develop and implement lesson plans.
* Work in collaboration with the assigned activity specialist.
* Keep accurate records of attendance, participant sign-out sheets, accidents, and incident reports.
* Keep and submit a daily report log of work tasks completed.
* Create and coordinate student performances and showcases.
* Attend team and group supervision meetings.
* Interact with teachers and school leadership team.
* Attend professional development trainings as required by the agency and program contract.
* Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

· Minimum Associate’s Degree in a related field or two years of experience working with students (elementary or middle-school aged) required.

· Must have a strong interest in working with school-aged children between the ages of 11 and 14.

· Must have the ability to work collaboratively with a wide range of program and school staff.

· Must have excellent communication (written and verbal), interpersonal, organizational, and administrative skills.

· Experience overseeing a group of young people preferred.

General Requirements: All staff are expected to be committed to the mission, vision, and values of Mission Society.

Salary & Benefits: Hourly wage of $19.25 per hour.

Apply: Interested and qualified individuals should forward their resumes with cover letter to HR@missionsociety.org. **Include in Subject Line: Re: HVA Group Leader, Power Academy.**  
Visit our website at www.missionsociety.org.

*Note: We are unable to accept phone calls. Applicants must meet qualifications stated above. Only applicants selected for further consideration will be contacted.* 

The Mission Society of New York City is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with the requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act. We encourage all qualified individuals to apply.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $19.25 per hour

Expected hours: 17 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* After school
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: NJ Medication Aide – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Medication Aides/Technicians** to help our residents in the daily management of their medication. Working in our Resident Services Wellness Department, your assistance is key in helping residents take their medications safely, consistently and as directed by their physicians. This is a key area where our residents count on reliable support, and your attention to detail and disciplined approach will make a positive impact on their lives. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The attentive and loving care you bring to the medication services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) and the administration of their medications
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness
* Ensuring the safety and wellbeing of all residents, while following company policies and procedures
* Following Medication Administration Records (MAR) and doctors' orders

**Full-time schedule includes one weekend shift per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).**

**Qualifications:**

* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times
* Extremely reliable, dependent and observant
* Ability to work one weekend day per week
* Must have at least an HHA/CNA certificate
* Solid understanding of MAR's and doctors' orders a plus (but we will train the right individual)
* Applicants must hold a New Jersey state med aide certification in order to apply for this position
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: NJ Resident Care Assistant/HHA – Per Diem
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Resident Care Assistants/Home Health Aides** with a skillset and a heart for helping residents make the most of each day. In this position, you'll be a friendly and familiar face to our residents, providing hands-on care in a respectful and dignified manner. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care you bring to the services you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs)
* Escorting residents to meals and recreational activities
* Supporting residents in achieving their highest level of physical, emotional and psycho-social well-being
* Helping out as needed in the Wellness area to ensure the safety, comfort and wellbeing of our residents
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness

**Qualifications:**

* NJ-Certified Nursing Assistant or Home Health Aide
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times

title: Evaluation Specialist
company: Achieve Beyond Pediatric Therapy and Autism Services
description:
**Our Mission**: We believe that all children have potential. We are guided by the mission to support children with special needs to Achieve Beyond their current abilities. We are always striving for continuous improvement by setting goals and measuring performance.It is the reason we will succeed together.

**Job Summary**: The Evaluation Department Manager is responsible for ensuring all children referred for evaluation receive high quality, clinically appropriate assessments in accordance with state and county regulations.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Ensure all reports submitted are of high quality and undergo quality assurance review
* Demonstrate a solid understanding of the evaluation process in the various programs
* Assist with supervision of all employees within the Evaluation Department
* Assist with billing issues as needed and ensure timely payment for completed evaluations
* Conduct daily department monitoring activities to ensure goals are met
* Attend IEP and IFSP meetings
* Conduct home and center-based evaluations and/or observations when necessary
* Conduct professional development workshops as needed
* Troubleshoot issues that may arise during the evaluation process
* Conduct quality assurance audits
* Communicate with various referral sources regarding pending cases
* Other duties as assigned by Director


Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:

* Individual must hold a valid certification as a School Psychologist, Special Education (Permanente or B-2) or master's in social work to ensure clinical competence.
* Successful experience working in a high-volume work environment where organizational and multi-tasking skills are essential.

Qualifications and Other Requirements:

* Knowledge of Microsoft Office and Outlook a must.
* Strong analytical skills
* Remain current regarding policy and regulations
**Physical Requirements of the Role (As applicable):**

**(Only include from below choices that are applicable to this role. Delete those that do not apply)**

* Must be able to travel to and from assigned work events including but not limited to driving personal vehicle, walking, and/or use of public transportation such as a bus or train.
* Occasionally ascends/descends stairs going to, while at, or leaving work location or facilities traveled to for work events.
* Occasionally moving and/or lifting objects at work weighing up to 20 pounds such as files or copy paper.
* Must be able to remain in a stationary position for prolonged periods of time up to 90% of the work day working on a computer/electronic device.
* The ability to observe details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).
* The ability to communicate information and ideas so others will understand. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.

Working in our Resident Services Wellness Department, your assistance is key in helping residents take their medications safely, consistently and as directed by their physicians. This is a key area where our residents count on reliable support, and your attention to detail and disciplined approach will make a positive impact on their lives. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The attentive and loving care you bring to the medication services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.

title: Waitstaff – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


One of the strengths that sets The Bristal apart as a luxury assisted living community is our chef-prepared cuisine and the country club dining experience we provide three times a day. We are seeking friendly, professional and, above all, compassionate **Waitstaff** with the kind, patient and cheerful spirit to deliver on that exceptional experience. You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as part of our Waitstaff team, your performance is key to making that happen. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring all meals are served and presented in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Food Service. The loving care, attention and great customer service you bring to the dining experience are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Patiently and cheerfully taking resident meal orders
* Checking station tables for settings and cleanliness
* Reading the menu before service so that you can knowledgeably assist the residents with their selections
* Assisting in the plating and proper portion controls of some or all of the following: appetizers, salads, soups, beverages and desserts
* Bussing tables at the end of the meal

**Must be able to work at least one weekend day per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).**


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Experience as a Waiter/Waitress in a restaurant or food-service-related industry
* Able to function in a fast-paced environment
* Have a strong ability to multi-task
* Possesses good communication, customer service and people skills
* Is professional, patient and able to satisfy a demanding customer base
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred, but not required
* Is a team player, willing to help out where needed to ensure a pleasurable dining experience
* Familiarity with food safety, food preparation and board of health guidelines is a plus
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times

**New Jersey locations: Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal accommodations**
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: Part-Time Group Fitness Coach
description:
**We are looking for a super positive, high-energy, and passionate, health and fitness-focused individual to join our team of coaches at Norwalk Fit Body Boot Camp.** 

We are **NOT** looking for someone:

* who takes shirtless selfies in the mirror and posts them to IG for "motivation"
* coaches like a drill sergeant leading a bunch of Navy Seals throughout hell week
* thinks that all of their clients need to deadlift 400 lbs or do a bikini competition
* has a master's in kinesiology but doesn't know how to make a client feel heard, seen, and cared for
* expects an easy job. (aka. just wants to just show up, coach a session, and go home)
* only wants to coach a class but never do any other work (some administrative work, programming, texting clients, etc.)
* Does not believe in a macro-based nutrition program

**Our ideal coach:**

* LOVES people.
* Is the type of person who could talk to anyone
* Is full of positive energy and shows up to work with a smile on their face
* Is passionate about helping people be the healthiest and happiest version of themselves
* Desires to have a long career in group fitness with one company
* Is looking to always grow, get better and reach their ultimate potential
* Is driven to exceed expectations and go above and beyond
* Is willing to work hard. Not kind of hard, like really hard.

**In other words, we care more about WHO you are, than WHAT you know!**

Our company is on a mission to change the fitness world and be daymakers in all of our client's lives.

Our coaches are the foundation of what we do. They play a fundamental role within the team and company culture as they lead our sessions and work closely with each client to provide the ultimate fitness experience.

**Responsibilities:**

* Coach 3-6 group sessions per shift
* Attend a weekly team meeting and engage with your team to help drive the vision and mission forward
* Attend quarterly team development trainings (they rotate between being held in person around the country and virtually)

**Experience, skills and requirements:**

* Must have open availability to coach any of our session blocks
* Applicants must have a nationally recognized fitness certification (such as: ACE, NASM, ACSM, ect.)
* Applicant must have an active CPR certification or ability to get one before starting
* Exceptionally personable
* Demonstrate a high level of emotional intelligence
* Experience or high-level understanding of excellent client service
* Enjoys working with a team on one common mission
* Ability to prioritize and meet goals in a fast-paced and changing environment
* Has a personal computer

**Job Overview:**

* Part-Time
* Starting Salary: $23.00/hour
* Plenty of opportunities for career advancement (we LOVE driven individuals who want to work their way up the ladder)

**COACHING SCHEDULE -** Our workouts are offered during the following coaching blocks below (although we are growing rapidly and sessions may be added to accommodate).

* Weekday Morning Coaching Shift - 5:00am-10:30am (4:30am clock-in)
* Weekday Evening Coaching Shift - 4:30pm-7:45pm (4pm clock-in)
* Saturday Morning Coaching Shift - 7:30am-10:30am (7am clock-in)

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $23.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 25 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Night shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Training: 1 year (Preferred)
* Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Certification for Group Training (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Maintenance Technician
company: The Arbors Assisted Living Islandia West
description:
**Do you love Seniors? We do! If you do we would love for you to come work for us.**

**The Arbors Assisted Living is currently hiring Maintenance Tech.**

**Looking for a Full-Time Maintenance Tech 8am - 4pm, Days Vary !**

Job Responsibilities:

· Follows a preventive maintenance program and record keeping system to maintain a physically functional Community at the highest attainable level.

· Maintains Community profile and physical plant history by maintaining complete documentation of all maintenance activities including accurate records of all replacement parts and materials used.

· Performs all routine maintenance and repair work included but not limited to: window washing, landscaping, snow removal, light bulb changes, daily floor cleaning of public spaces, etc.

· Maintains electrical and mechanical and plumbing equipment in good working condition; adjusts functional parts of devices and control instruments, lubricates and cleans all accessible mechanical equipment and their related parts, changes filters, lubricates drug carts, housekeeping carts etc. Repairs and maintains outdoor furniture; Reports serious mechanical failures and problems to Administrator.

· Checks light bulbs and exit lights, heat and water temperatures, circuit breakers and call light systems for each room and makes adjustments; Maintains the temperature log and emergency call systems.

· Cleans lint, dust and dirt from dryers, vents and heat registers; Cleans condenser coil in refrigeration units and H.V.A.C. units; Washes garbage cans; Washes windows and insect screens outside the building.

· Keeps grounds cleared of debris; Collects and disposes of leaves and refuse in keeping with local code.

· Performs resident room maintenance as required or directed.

· Performs work orders as issued

· Checks window for presence of screens and glass.

· Insures proper functioning of back-up emergency supply if it exists, by testing once per month and documenting in log as required.

· Check and clean bathroom exhaust fans on a regularly scheduled basis.

· Checks all fire extinguishers for correct position, charges and storage;

· Check emergency / fire doors for proper closure as required and make necessary adjustments.

· Attends on-the-job training for new employees; and attends periodic staff meetings.

· Coordinates work of department with work of other departments; attends and participates in scheduled in-service programs, staff meetings and department head meetings; assists in developing departmental procedures and promotes employee stabilization and productivity; maintains required records and reports.

· Maintains confidentiality of necessary information; thinks and acts calmly and logically to meet unusual occurrences of the job without being thrown off stride.

· Prepares resident rooms for move-in incompliance with move-in checklist. Includes cleaning out of room after resident moves out, painting and cleaning of carpet and following up with housekeeping.

· Cleans carpets with carpet cleaning machine throughout community on a regularly scheduled basis.

**\\*\\*\\*\\*We Do NYS Department Of Health Mandated Background Checks/Fingerprinting for all New Hires.**

To apply: Please submit resume OR apply in person at:

The Arbors Assisted Living Islandia West  
1515 Veterans Memorial Hwy.

Islandia West, NY 11749

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Maintenance: 2 years (Required)

title: Instructor -Kids Art
description:
Are you an artist, hobbyest, crafter or art educator? Come be a part of the Little Makers Community! We are seeking passionate and imaginative people to join us.

At Little Makers Studio, we believe every child holds within them a universe of potential, a canvas of dreams. We use arts and crafts to invite kids to express themselves and inspire curiosity in the world around them. We are not just fostering their ability to make and create; we are nurturing thinkers, dreamers, and the innovators of tomorrow.

We offer unique art and craft sessions and workshops, drop-off art activities, birthday parties and mini-camps for children ages 1.5-12.

\\*\\*Position:\\*\\* Instructor

\\*\\*Location:\\*\\* Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, NY

---

\\*\\*Key Responsibilities:\\*\\*

1. \\*\\*Instructional Delivery:\\*\\*

- Conduct engaging art & craft classes for children aged 1.5-12. Project plans provided.

- Ensure instruction is age-appropriate, educational, and enjoyable.

- Adapt teaching methods to cater to individual student needs and capabilities.

2. \\*\\*Program and Workshop Development:\\*\\*

- Collaborate with the founder/program director to create and refine class materials.

- Stay updated with latest art & craft trends to introduce fresh, exciting projects.

3. \\*\\*Class Management:\\*\\*

- Prepare materials and ensure the studio is set up before each session.

- Enforce safety protocols and maintain a clean, organized, and inspiring environment.

- Clean up and re-stock supplies as needed

4. \\*\\*Parental Engagement:\\*\\*

- Communicate student progress and provide feedback to parents/guardians.

- Address any parental concerns with empathy and professionalism.

5. \\*\\*Makers Marketplace\\*\\*

* Provide customer service for our Marketplace.
* Recommend products and services
* Facilitate purchase/check-out

---

\\*\\*Required Qualifications:\\*\\*

- In pursuit of Bachelor's degree in Art, Education, or related fields.

- 3-5 years experience working with children

- Strong knowledge of art materials, safety protocols, and age-appropriate teaching methods.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to inspire, motivate, and connect with children of diverse backgrounds and abilities.

- CPR and First Aid certification (or willingness to obtain).

\\*\\*Preferred Qualifications:\\*\\*

- Knowledge of STEM-inspired art & craft projects

- Familiarity with process art education

---

\\*\\*What We Offer:\\*\\*

* Part-time hours. **M-F 8:30am-1pm, 12pm-4pm and 2pm-6:30pm**. **Weekends 9am-2pm & 12pm-5pm (times/days are subject to change)**
* Competitive hourly wage with performance-based bonuses. Pay range $20-$25
* Estimated start Early July 2024

- Opportunity for continuous professional development.

- A fun, dynamic, and supportive work environment.

---

\\*\\*Application Instructions:\\*\\*

Interested candidates should submit a resume, a cover letter detailing their relevant experience. Please email all application materials to bianca@littlemakersstudio.com with the subject line "Instructor Application - [Your Name]".

\\*Little Makers Studio is an Equal Opportunity Employer and values diversity. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.\\*

---

title: Authorization Manager
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*
Always Compassionate Home Care provides the highest quality of community home-based services, combined with exceptional compassion and innovation to enhance each patient’s quality of life.
Title: Authorization Manager
Location: Melville, NY
Salary Range: $80,000-$85,000
The Authorization Manager is responsible for overseeing the pre-authorization and billing process for home care services. This role involves coordinating with insurance companies, healthcare providers, and patients to ensure that services are pre-approved and billed accurately.
Responsibilities:* Coordinate with insurance companies to secure pre-authorization for home care services.
* Review patient records to ensure all necessary documentation is completed before submitting authorization requests.
* Communicate with healthcare providers to gather required clinical information.
* Oversee the billing process, including claim submission, payment posting, and adjustments.
* Ensure that all claims are submitted accurately and in a timely manner.
* Monitor claim status and address any discrepancies or denials promptly.
* Provide training, guidance, and support to staff to improve accuracy and efficiency.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations, including HIPAA and payer guidelines.
* Maintain accurate records of pre-authorization requests, approvals, and billing activities.
* Audit billing and authorization processes regularly to identify areas for improvement.
* Investigate and resolve issues related to denied claims, missing information, or billing errors.
* Work with insurance representatives to appeal denied claims and secure payment.
* Prepare and present reports (as needed) on authorization and billing performance, including metrics on claim denial rates and turnaround times.
* Analyze data to identify trends and recommend process improvements.


Qualifications:* Bachelor’s degree in Healthcare Administration, Business, or related field preferred.
* Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in healthcare billing.
* Strong knowledge of insurance pre-authorization processes and billing practices.
* Proficiency in billing software and electronic medical records (EMR) systems.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.
* Certification in Medical Billing or Coding (e.g., CPC, CPB) is a plus.
* Experience with home care or hospice billing.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Benefits:* Health/Dental Coverage
* Vision Coverage
* 401K
* AFLAC
* Paid Time Off


Always Compassionate Home Care provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, status as a parent, national origin, age, disability (physical or mental), family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, or any other non-merit based factors protected federal, state, or local law. All employment related decisions are based solely on relevant criteria including experience and suitability.  

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

265 Broadhollow Road, Suite 200
Melville, NY 11747
