Join our nursing staff and make a difference at a great community based hospital, Montefiore New Rochelle. The hospital is part of the Montefiore Health System, a premier academic health system serving more than 3 million people living in the New York City region and Hudson Valley. We have a great opportunity for a full time ICU overnight RN.

Job Duties include:

* Provides for safety in the coordination and delivery of care.
* Consistently communicates with patients by listening attentively and providing feedback to ensure that all needs are met in a timely manner.
* Keeps patients pain well controlled.
* Assess and reassesses patients' status, initiating and resolving patient goals.
* Treating patients accurately and safely according to unit specific parameters and best practices.
* Provides for patient confidentiality, privacy and dignity.
* Performs hourly rounds.
* Answers call lights or requests from patients in a timely and courteous manner.
* Utilizes hand-off communication in all interdisciplinary reporting.
* Responds appropriately in emergency situations.
* Participates in and positively influences quality improvement initiatives.
* Fosters cooperative relationships and positive work environment with other departments through courtesy, respect and effective communication.

* 1-3 yrs of prior experience.

title: Advocate Counselor BCHS
description:
**BRONX COMMUNITY H.S. ADVOCATE COUNSELOR** 

Mission Society of New York City improves the lives of children, youth, and families in the city’s most underserved communities. Through programs and services that respond to community needs, we create cycles of success for generations to come.

The *Level Up Program* administered at *Bronx Community High School* is a collaboration with the NYC Department of Education and New York City Mission Society. The program assists students, who are over-aged and under-credentialed, in acquiring the skills, knowledge, attitudes and behavioral changes that will maximize their potential. The program’s aim is to enable students to graduate high school, transition into post-secondary education, or into meaningful permanent employment.

**Position Summary**

**Title:** Advocate Counselor

**Program:** Bronx Community High School

**Reports To**: Program Director

**Supervises:** 

**Employment Status**: Full-Time Non-Exempt

**Basic Function:**

Provide comprehensive support services to program participants as required by the Level Up program contract and appropriate to students’ needs. Outreach to students who fail to attend school. Provide individual and group counseling to assist students with their social-emotional and academic growth. Assist senior staff in implementing post-secondary counseling and internship programs.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

· Establish a rapport with program participants.

· Provide attendance support and individual counseling on a monthly basis to caseload of program participants.

· Provide individual- and group-counseling focusing on post-secondary planning, social-emotional development, and career-readiness skills.

· Collaborate with other Level Up and Department of Education staff to track student progress and attendance, develop individualized participant support plans, and conduct telephone, in-school, and home visit outreach.

· Input data in multiple databases in a timely manner.

· Identify participants educational and career goals and help them to develop post-secondary plan.

· Assist Internship Placement Specialist in matching participants to appropriate internship opportunities.

· Assist Level Up Social Worker in providing crisis intervention services.

· Accompany participants on day- and overnight- trips to locations within and outside of New York State.

· Staff is expected to be committed to the mission, vision, and values of Mission Society and Bronx Community High School.

· Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**

· Minimum of B.A. or B.S. degree

· Bilingual Spanish or French preferred

· Demonstrated interest in working with low-income students and/or students of color

· Knowledge of basic youth development principles

· Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment

· Detail oriented and capable of managing multiple simultaneous projects

**General Requirements**

Staff is expected to be committed to the mission, vision, and values of Mission Society.

**Salary and Benefits**

Salary range: $49,500-$52,500 based on experience, qualifications and fit. Comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, life, long term disability insurance, 403(b) retirement plan with 5% employer contribution, TransitChek, Employee Wellness Program, Municipal Credit Union membership, voluntary supplemental insurance options.

**Apply**

Interested and qualified individuals should forward their resumes with cover letter to: HR@missionsociety.org, RE: Bronx Community High School Advocate Counselor Position.

Visit our website at www.nycmissionsociety.org.

Note: We are unable to accept phone calls. Applicants must meet the qualifications stated above. Only applicants selected for further consideration will be contacted.

*Mission Society of New York City is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $49,500.00 - $52,500.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance

* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Manager of Institutional Giving
description:
**ABOUT LATINOJUSTICE PRLDEF**

Founded in 1972 as the Puerto Rican Legal Defense and Education Fund, LatinoJustice PRLDEF (LJP) has been a leading civil rights and social justice organization for five decades. LJP’s core issue areas include voting rights and redistricting, economic justice, immigrant rights, criminal legal system (policing and prison) reform, racial justice, leadership development, and issues related to Puerto Rico. LJP uses impact litigation, advocacy, and community education and engagement, among other strategies, to protect and advance the rights of Latinx and other communities of color. LJP has offices in New York City, Orlando, FL, and Austin, TX.

Working under the supervision of the Director of institutional Giving, the Manager of Institutional Giving is a full-time employee responsible for managing the institutional giving strategy which includes the grant proposal process. Key activities include researching institutional funding prospects, drafting proposals and reports, and managing the grants calendar. Other development duties may be assigned as needed. The Manager of Institutional Giving reports to the Director of Institutional Giving and is a member of the development staff.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

The Manager of Institutional Giving will:

* Work with the Director and other LJP staffers to cultivate new institutional funding prospects and steward existing institutional donors.
* Responsible for conducting the full range of activities required to prepare, submit, and manage grant proposals to foundation, corporate and government sources owning the final outcome.
* Develop an understanding of institutional history and programs as well as organizational history with institutional funders.
* Perform prospect research and provide evaluations of possible funders to the Director of institutional Giving and appropriate program staff.
* Inform and implement strategies to align with funder priorities.
* Draft and edit proposals and secure appropriate reviews, in a timely manner, prior to submission as needed.
* Populate, maintain and share the grants calendar and all follow-up tasks required to meet deadlines.
* Have primary responsibility to enter grant, reporting and funder data into the LJP development database and to pull and provide reports related to institutional funding.
* Maintain up-to-date files of customary attachments for grant proposals such as audited statements and relevant media publications.
* Inform appropriate staff when grants are secured and ensure compliance with all reporting that may be required by institutional donors.
* Manage the New York Statewide Financial System for grant application and reporting.
* Takes ownership of projects assigned to them and assertively follows through, seeking guidance, assistance and feedback as needed from the Director and other project collaborators.

**EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience.
* Detail-oriented, organized self-starter, able to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
* Strong verbal and written communicator, who is comfortable engaging with peers and funders both in person and via digital and other communication channels.
* Ability to write clear, structured, articulate, and persuasive proposals.
* Familiarity with research techniques and knowledge of fundraising information sources for prospect research including Foundation Center online.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office (particularly Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook)
* Proficient in DonorPerfect or similar CRM.
* Able to work successfully in a small team environment.
* Strong organizational ability to multi-task and effectively manage time
* Takes initiative, as appropriate, communicating effectively and working well independently and as part of a team
* Ability to protect sensitive information by maintaining the highest level of discretion and confidentiality

:

Please note: LJP staff works in hybrid model with 60% flexible remote work.

**COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS**

This is a Union position and salary is determined by a Collective Bargaining Agreement. The salary range for this position is based on years of experience, starting at $88,545 for five (5) years of experience.

LJP offers a comprehensive benefit package that includes health, dental, vision, life, long-term disability, and a voluntary 403(b) retirement plan, as well as generous paid time off benefits.

title: Solar Service Technician
description:
**Job description**

Solar Service Technician

The Solar Service Technician (Service Tech) is responsible for performing preventative and corrective maintenance, system commissioning, troubleshooting and generally maintaining customer owned and commercial solar assets. The Service Tech role is responsible for managing time and resources so that O&M customers are serviced promptly and effectively.

Responsibilities include:

* Electrical troubleshooting of residential and commercial projects
* Preventative and corrective maintenance on residential and commercial PV systems
* Initial commissioning and startup of residential and commercial PV projects
* Module cleaning
* Working at heights
* Adherence to safety procedures
* Process improvement and innovation
* Electronic monitoring set-up
* Light estimating duties for corrective maintenance
* Emergency service calls (after hours work sometimes required)
* Occasional out of state site visit (25%-50%)
* Ability to lift 50-100 lbs.

A person with a background in electrical installation or solar electrical systems, and customer service is preferred. A successful candidate will have strong organizational and customer service skills. Experience working on residential and commercial construction projects is desired.

Educational, professional and/or other requirements:

* Understanding of electrical theory and applications
* High school graduate
* Ability to innovate and improve operations and solve complex problems
* Positive attitude and energy desired

Job Type: Full-time

title: Eligibility Specialist
description:
**Position**: Eligibility Specialist

**Supervisor**: Controller

**Job Summary**: The Eligibility Specialist at Abilis plays a crucial role in ensuring accurate and timely management of government funding sources, including DSS, DDS, and SSA/SSI. This position requires adherence to agency policies and federal regulations, with a focus on managing funding, tracking payments, and reporting. The specialist will work closely with the Controller, Finance Director, and accounting team, and is responsible for supporting the agencys financial operations, including audits and special projects.

**Schedule**: Monday - Friday, 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM (Exempt Position)

**Essential Functions**:

* Implement and adhere to agency policies, state and federal regulations, and ensure confidentiality.
* Track and manage DSS and SSA/SSI funding, handle monthly reports, and address funding discrepancies.
* Maintain comprehensive client files, complete government and internal reports accurately and on time, and assist with annual audits.
* Work effectively as part of a team to resolve accounting issues and support the Controller and Finance Director on special projects.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* Track client wages, DSS, SSA, and SSI income monthly.
* Investigate and resolve missing checks or payment errors.
* Complete and distribute redeterminations and other required reports.
* Ensure proper invoicing for medical supplies and report client status changes.
* Distribute personal funds timely and accurately.
* Review and submit DDS and EDS Attendance Reports.
* Maintain accurate personal fund records and ensure proper distribution.
* Conduct audits of residential home financial records.
* Prepare and review audit reports.
* Provide training to Residential Program Managers and Assistant Managers on financial record maintenance.
* Bachelors Degree in Social Work, Business Management, or related field, or equivalent experience.
* 3-5 years of experience in social work, bookkeeping, or accounting.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Windows, Excel, Word) with a willingness to learn new software.

title: Security Industrial Control Systems - OT Consultant
description:
**Accenture** is a global collective of innovators whose aim is to improve the way the world works and lives. Empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community of diverse talent, we drive success in new business architecture that disrupts conventional practices. And we are looking to add an experienced **ICS (Industrial Control Systems)/OT (Operational Technology) Cybersecurity Consultant** to an already outstanding team.

**Accenture Security** helps organizations prepare, protect, detect, respond to, and recover, at all points of the security lifecycle. We hire the very best security talent and arm them with the coolest tools and latest tech so they can help our clients build resilience as we create integrated, customized turnkey solutions. We blend risk strategy, digital identity, cyber defense, application security and managed service solutions to rethink the entire security lifecycle.

**You Are** passionate about security, love what you do and have a genuine desire to outsmart the bad guys. You have the experience to analyze a clients’ security posture, anticipate security requirements and help find right-sized solutions based on industry leading practices. You have a proven track record working successfully in a fast-paced, agile environment.

**The Work** is an exciting opportunity to lead, influence and execute on ICS/OT security engagements in critical infrastructure and/or mission critical industry environments. In this role, you will assess, identify, and develop security solutions for OT environments and the latest industrial technologies across multiple industries. Responsibilities include helping clients access their security posture, recommend improvements and implementing those solutions. Assessments include security frameworks, existing security measures and alignment with best practices. In addition, you’ll have the opportunity perform testing against ICS/OT devices, networks and security control mechanisms. This includes testing on devices used in the field as well as future deployment devices, and investigation of device ecosystem and monitoring.


Ideal candidates for this category have previous experience supporting the following:

* Monitoring & response operations for OT environments, equipment, and/or systems,
* OT security sensor/tool deployment,
* OT security assessment experience,
* OT security program/governance development,
* Systems Engineering experience within OT environments

  

**Basic Qualifications**

* Minimum 2 years’ relevant experience (e.g., manufacturing facilities, and/or oil and gas facilities, and/or automotive plants, and/or electric substations, and/or water treatment facilities, and/or power generation facilities, and/or natural gas environments, and/or life sciences, and/or data center OT, etc.)
* Minimum 1 years’ experience working with ICS technologies and/or environments. Examples include: SCADA, DCS, EMS, DMS, ADMS, PCN, RTUs, IACS, PLCs, HMIs, etc.
* Minimum 6 months experience with cybersecurity functions including vulnerability assessment and management processes, identity and access management in ICS environments, incident response and monitoring, etc.
* Minimum 6 months experience of common ICS protocols and technologies.
* Minimum 6 months experience authoring detailed reports or deliverables based on security assessments and recommendations with ability to present findings to non-technical executive staff
* Minimum 1 year of experience in IT or OT networking infrastructure (Switches, Firewalls, Routers, etc.)
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associate’s Degree, must have minimum 6 years work experience)
* Travel will be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Minimum 1 years’ experience assessing against standards and frameworks including DOE C2M2, IEC-62243/ISA-99, NIST CSF, NERC CIP, etc.
* Minimum 2 years’ experience providing consulting services to Fortune / Global 1000 clients and/or domain experience within relevant industry verticals such as Oil and Gas, Utilities, Manufacturing, etc.
* At least one relevant industry certification (CISSP, GICSP, GRID, GCIP, etc.).
* Experience in deploying OT Security Sensors in operational environments
* Minimum 6 months experience performing reverse engineering of embedded devices and/or industrial protocols.
* Minimum 6 months experience designing, organizing, and executing security assessments and testing
* Minimum 6 months experience developing proposals, SOW’s, and general content to support business capture
* Minimum 6 months experience working with security analysis techniques, identifying indicators of compromise, threat hunting, and identification of intrusions and potential incidents.
* Minimum 1 year experience working in SOC's with security tooling such as OT NSM's, SIEMs, Endpoint Security tools for Operational Environments
* Master’s Degree in computer science, cybersecurity, or similar educational study

title: Barback
description:
**Position Summary:**


Are you ready to be part of something extraordinary? EL Bar – Tequila & Mezcal Bar, a subsidiary of City Winery, is launching at the vibrant Pier 57, and we're looking for dynamic Barbacks to join our team! If you’re passionate about tequila and mezcal this is the perfect opportunity for you.

**Overview of Responsibilities:**

* Ensure the bar is fully stocked with glassware, garnishes, ice, and other necessary supplies before and during service.
* Assist bartenders by fetching ingredients, preparing garnishes, and maintaining a clean work area to ensure smooth service.
* Keep the bar area clean and organized, including wiping down surfaces, emptying trash, and washing glassware throughout the shift.
* Monitor stock levels of beverages and supplies, reporting shortages to the bartender or manager
* Set up bar equipment and ensure everything is functioning correctly at the beginning of each shift.
* Provide friendly and courteous service to guests, answering questions and assisting with their needs when the bartenders are busy.
* Carry and move heavy boxes of stock, kegs, and other supplies from storage areas to the bar.
* Adhere to health, safety, and cleanliness standards at all times, including proper handling of glassware and equipment.
* Assist in setting up and breaking down for events, ensuring the bar is ready for service before guests arrive.

**Your Strengths & Qualifications****:**

* Previous experience in a bar, restaurant, or hospitality setting
* Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds regularly and remain on your feet for extended periods.
* Reliable, punctual, and able to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.
* Meticulous in keeping the bar clean, stocked, and organized.
* Willingness to support the bartending team and contribute to a positive work environment.
* Capable of handling a variety of tasks quickly and efficiently, with a willingness to learn new skills.
* Clear and effective communicator, able to take direction and work well with others.
* Ability to work nights, weekends, and holidays as needed.
* Friendly and approachable demeanor, with a focus on providing excellent service to guests.
* Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds regularly, and stand for extended periods during shifts.

**Why Join Us?**


EL Bar is not just a bar – it's a celebration of the terroir-driven spirits of tequila and mezcal. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of education, exploration, and appreciation for the rich histories and vibrant cultures behind these spirits. Located at the iconic Pier 57, EL Bar offers a unique and exciting environment for both guests and staff. Join us and be part of creating a one-of-a-kind experience on the waterfront.

  

INDBOH

title: Bartender
description:
Are you ready to be part of something extraordinary? EL Bar – Tequila & Mezcal Bar, a subsidiary of City Winery, is launching at the vibrant Pier 57 rooftop, and we're looking for dynamic Bartenders to join our team! If you’re passionate about tequila and mezcal, and have a talent for crafting exceptional cocktails and sharing the rich stories behind every spirit, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

**Overview of Responsibilities:**

* Prepare and serve a wide range of tequila and mezcal-based cocktails to guests, ensuring high-quality and consistent drinks.
* Maintain an organized and well-stocked bar, keeping all items organized and in reset between shifts
* Stay informed on our tequila and mezcal offerings, and be able to discuss them knowledgeably with guests.


 Follow all health and safety regulations, ensuring a clean and safe work environment. Provide friendly, efficient, and attentive service to all guests, contributing to a positive and memorable experience.

* Assist with regular bar duties, including setup, breakdown, and cleaning

**Your Strengths & Qualifications****:**

* Minimum of 2 years of bartending experience in a high-volume, upscale environment.
* Strong knowledge of tequila, mezcal, and other spirits, with the ability to craft and recommend cocktails. Proven ability to deliver exceptional customer service and create a welcoming atmosphere for guests.
* Meticulous with drink preparation, ensuring consistency and quality in every cocktail served.
* Excellent verbal communication skills, able to interact effectively with guests and team members.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, handling multiple orders and tasks efficiently.
* Strong team player, willing to assist colleagues and contribute to the overall success of the bar.
* Knowledge of health and safety regulations, including responsible alcohol service practices.
* Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds regularly, and stand for extended periods during shifts.
* Willingness to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed.

**Why Join Us?**


EL Bar is not just a bar – it's a celebration of the terroir-driven spirits of tequila and mezcal. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of education, exploration, and appreciation for the rich histories and vibrant cultures behind these spirits. Located at the iconic Pier 57, EL Bar offers a unique and exciting environment for both guests and staff. Join us and be part of creating a one-of-a-kind experience on the waterfront.

  

INDFOH

title: Shift Leader
description:
**SMASHBURGER**

**Shift Leader**


Our first Smashburger restaurant opened in 2007 with one single notion in mind; **to serve a better burger**! Better burgers takes better service, support and teamwork. That's why we treat our team members fairly in a diverse and safe environment. With an average of 10 restaurants opening each year, we invest in building internal opportunities for our teams’ learning and growth.” **We just build better**. Better Burgers. Better Teams. Better Experiences.

 **Better Benefits: Build a better experience work & lifestyle!**

* Tip share-earn up to $2/hr. extra in tips
* Get Paid $ to Refer your Friends\\*
* RGMs, RMs, & SLs are entitled to one (1) free meal each shift they work \\*
* Flexible schedules in a fun, family friendly, team environment
* Medical, Dental and Vision Options\\*\\*
* Paid time off – vacation and sick\\*\\*
* 401K match (21 and older)
* Employee Assistance Program
* Fast track for career opportunities and management experience
* Free uniform

*\\*\\*Eligibility based off of time in position and average hours worked*

* *Referred Employees Must Be in Good Standing & Referee must be employed with Smashburger at time of payout. Bonus is paid in two distributions*

 **Shift Leader Responsibilities**

* Reporting to the Restaurant General Manager, our Shift Leaders are the champions of better burgers! In this role you will:
* Manage the performance of both FOH & BOH employees
* Promote a fun and positive work environment
* Manage the effectiveness of people focused processes and systems
* Provide initial and ongoing training to all employees within the unit utilizing SmashConnect, LMS, and 4 step method of training
* Reward and recognizes employee performance that exceeds company standards
* Manage with integrity the daily completion of operational check lists to include
* Line checks and uniform standards
* Opening/closing check lists
* Safe and deposit logs
* Manage the guest experience metrics (NPS and OSAT)
* Manage FSC operational standards daily
* Ensure all food safety standards are followed & in compliance with local health depts.
* Exemplify guest service on each shift of the day and communicates SIZZLE service standards to the employees
* Manage the successful onboarding and training for all new employees
* Follow COGS management procedures for food ordering and inventory
* Follow company cash policies to ensure minimal losses through theft or shortages
* Manage daily labor

 **Shift Leader Requirements**

* Previous Shift Leader Experience
* 90-day completion of train the trainer course
* Flexible to work nights, weekends, and holidays
* Follow Smashburger uniform standards
* Ability to follow all guidelines and procedures set forth by Smashburger, local, state, and federal employment regulations
* Must successfully complete Smashburger training program
* Possess strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively communicate with restaurant management, front line employees and corporate support teams
* People management skills to effectively select, assess, coach/counsel, develop, motivate, and lead restaurant teams
* Excellent attention to detail
* Proven time management, consistency, and organizational skills
* Highly motivated, self-directed, and results driven
* Physical ability to stand for extended periods of time and to move and lift boxes of food/ supplies up to 50 lbs.
* Ability to work in high temperatures

*All applicants and employees have an equal opportunity for employment and advancement within Smashburger. Smashburger is dedicated to the principles of equal employment opportunity. We prohibit unlawful discrimination against applicants, prospective applicants, or employees on the basis of age 40 and over, race, sex, color, religion, national origin, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other applicable status protected by state or local law. This prohibition includes unlawful harassment based on any of these protected classes. Unlawful harassment includes verbal or physical conduct which has the purpose or effect of substantially interfering with an individual’s work performance or creating an intimidating, hostile, or offensive work environment. We maintain a workplace free of racial slurs and bias. This policy applies to all employees, including managers, supervisors, co-workers, and non-employees such as customers, clients, vendors, consultants, etc. Any conduct in violation of these company policies is also a violation of the law. Employees who engage in, ratify, or perpetuate discrimination, harassment or retaliation will be subject to disciplinary action, up to and including immediate discharge.*

title: Office Manager
description:
**The Company**


Seaport Entertainment Group is a premier entertainment & hospitality company that owns and operates a unique collection of assets positioned at the intersection of entertainment and real estate. Seaport Entertainment Group’s focus is to deliver unparalleled customer experiences through a combination of restaurant, live entertainment, sports, retail and hospitality offerings integrated into one-of-a-kind real estate. Our assets include the Seaport neighborhood in Lower Manhattan and the Las Vegas Aviators® Triple-A Minor League Baseball team and Las Vegas Ballpark, as well as the company's ownership stake in Jean-Georges Restaurants and its interest in the air rights above the Fashion Show Mall, which may be used to create a new casino and hotel on the Las Vegas Strip.

**About The Role****:**


The Office Manager will be responsible for overseeing the daily operations of the office, ensuring a productive and efficient work environment. This role requires exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously. The ideal candidate will be a proactive problem solver with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to manage office resources effectively.

 **What You Will Do**

* Oversee daily office operations, including managing office supplies, equipment, and facilities. Ensure the office environment is clean, organized, and conducive to productivity. This includes:
* Perform coffee machine cleaning cycle, restock milk, cups etc. throughout the day
* Stock refrigerators with food and drinks; stock snacks
* Unload dishwasher in the morning and turn on dishwasher before leaving the office for the evening
* Clean out refrigerators weekly
* Monitor guest bathrooms throughout the day, replenish supplies (hand soap, toilet paper, hand towels, etc.)
* Monitor copiers and restock paper supply in the cabinets; alert IT if there are any issues with the machines
* Monitor executive kitchen throughout the day, restock/order supplies
* Provide administrative support to executives and staff, including scheduling meetings, coordinating travel arrangements, and preparing reports and presentations.
* Monitor conference rooms throughout the day, prepare conference rooms for use after each meeting.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external communications. Handle phone calls, emails, and correspondence professionally and promptly. Maintains employee phone list. Clear voicemail messages regularly from the main line
* Sort and distribute mail, UPS & FedEx; prepare overnight/courier deliveries as requested
* Prepare offices/desks for new employees
* Manage access badges for the building
* Assist with budgeting and expense tracking. Process invoices, manage office-related expenditures, and work with the accounting team to ensure accuracy.
* Ensure the office complies with company policies and legal requirements. Implement and maintain health and safety procedures.
* Coordinate and manage office projects and initiatives, including organizing company events, office relocations, and IT upgrades. Orders catering for meetings as requested.
* Liaise with vendors and service providers to negotiate contracts, resolve issues, and ensure timely delivery of services and supplies.
 **About You****:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field preferred.
* Minimum of 2-4 years of experience in office management or a similar administrative role.
* Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and office management software (e.g., CRM systems).
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to interact effectively with all levels of staff and external contacts.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle unexpected challenges with professionalism and creativity.
* High level of accuracy and attention to detail in all aspects of work.
* Ability to foster a positive and productive work environment.
 **Compensation** **range:** **82,000****– 100,000**

 **NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES**


Please note that Seaport Entertainment Group does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, SEG will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, SEG explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Seaport Entertainment Group.

  

This job description is not meant to be an “all-inclusive” list of the duties and responsibilities of this job. Other related duties and responsibilities may be assigned. Seaport Entertainment Group reserves the right to change or modify job duties as necessary based on business necessity.


INDMANAGE

title: Customer Service Associate
description:
**\\*\\*This position requires driving to client sites in the Metro NY and Lower Fairfield County Areas at least 3 days per week.\\*\\***

 **Position Overview:**

  


We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Customer Service Associate to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 2-5 years of experience in customer service, with a strong focus on analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and exceptional communication. This role involves extensive travel (approximately 80%) to client sites between Fairfield County, Connecticut and the Metro New York areas, where you will engage in direct, face-to-face interactions with customers, addressing their concerns and developing solutions tailored to their needs.



In addition to client-facing responsibilities, this role requires close collaboration with the sales and dispatch teams to resolve issues, incorporate best practices, and optimize the customer experience. The successful candidate will be forward-thinking, process-oriented, and capable of identifying new opportunities based on customer feedback. Another key component of this role is heavy documentation and research to ensure up-to-date knowledge of company products, services, and processes.

 **Essential Responsibilities:**


* **Client Partnership:** Collaborate closely with customers to understand their specific challenges and partner with them to develop customized solutions. Ensure customer satisfaction by providing timely and effective support.
* **Customer Engagement:** Serve as the primary point of contact for customers, proactively anticipate needs, address concerns and complaints promptly and professionally. Build and maintain strong customer relationships through effective communication and problem resolution.
* **Analytical Problem Solving:** Leverage strong analytical skills to diagnose customer issues, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions that align with customer needs.
* **Travel & Direct Client Interaction:** Must be able to travel to client sites (approx. 80% travel required) to provide in-person support, build relationships, and ensure a seamless customer experience.
* **Cross-Functional Liaison:** Act as a bridge between the sales and dispatch teams, facilitating communication, resolving issues, and ensuring best practices are followed. Work to optimize processes and enhance the overall customer experience.
* **Process Improvement:** Identify opportunities for process improvements based on customer feedback and internal insights. Implement strategies to enhance service delivery and customer satisfaction.
* **Documentation & Research:** Maintain detailed records of customer interactions, issues, and solutions. Conduct research to stay informed about company products, services, and processes, ensuring that you provide accurate and up-to-date information to customers.


**Qualifications:**


* 2-5 years of experience in customer service, client relations, or a related role.
* Ability to travel extensively (approximately 80% travel required) and engage in direct client interactions.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop and implement effective solutions.
* Forward-thinking approach with a focus on continuous improvement.
* Excellent administrative, written, and verbal communication skills.
* Detail-oriented with a strong focus on accuracy and documentation.
* Proven ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic environment.
* Experience working cross-functionally.
* Strong organizational skills and ability to work independently.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office/Teams.


* Bachelor’s degree in Business Management or relevant job experience.
* Fluent in Spanish A PLUS.

title: Home Care Business Development Representative RUSSIAN bilingual preferred
description:
**Full job description**

**About us:**

Home Family Care has been a trusted provider of comprehensive home care services for over 10 years, serving the diverse needs of clients across New York. Committed to enhancing the quality of life for our clients and their families, we offer personalized care solutions delivered with compassion, professionalism, and respect.

**Job Description:**  
As a Home Care Marketer at Home Family Care, you will play a pivotal role in expanding our reach and fostering relationships within the community. Your primary responsibility will be to promote our services to potential clients, healthcare professionals, and community organizations. You will be a key representative of our organization, advocating for our mission and values while driving growth and engagement.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement strategic marketing plans to generate leads and increase client referrals.
* Build and maintain relationships with healthcare professionals, hospitals, rehabilitation centers, assisted living facilities, and other referral sources.
* Conduct outreach activities, including networking events, health fairs, and community presentations, to raise awareness of Home Family Care.
* Collaborate with our community intake team to facilitate the intake process for new clients.
* Provide education and training sessions to healthcare professionals and community members on our services.
* Track marketing metrics and analyze data to assess the effectiveness of marketing strategies and campaigns.
* Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and market developments to identify opportunities for growth and innovation.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in marketing, sales, or business development, preferably in the healthcare or home care industry.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport with diverse population.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written.
* Self-motivated with a results-oriented mindset and a passion for making a positive impact.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including paid time off.
* Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
* Supportive and collaborative work environment with a focus on employee well-being and work-life balance.

title: Underage Purchaser
description:
Computer Evidence Specialists has been selected by the Federal government to serve as the Federal Tobacco Compliance Check vendor in New York. CES inspectors and underage purchasers will perform non-confrontational compliance checks on local tobacco retailers to ensure the sale of tobacco products to minors is restricted.

Ideal underage purchasers will be 16 – 20 years old, have a strong work ethic, and have sufficient free time to complete the assigned inspections with the inspector. Purchasers must complete the following forms which will be provided by CES: Parental Release, Medical Release, Underage Purchaser Agreement, Non-Disclosure Agreement and Commitment to Protect Non-Public Information.

Underage Purchaser Responsibilities:

* Complete short online training course.
* Access to a car is not needed for the underage purchaser.
* Purchaser will not deceive the retailer in any way.

*Will dress normally, use valid identification, and will not lie about their age.*

* Compensated at **$16.00/hour.**

title: Marketing Insights Analyst
description:
\\*\\*Job Title:\\*\\* Marketing Insights Analyst

\\*\\*Number of Positions:\\*\\* 1

\\*\\*Location:\\*\\* Parsippany, New Jersey

﻿

\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\*

The position requires candidates to be local to New Jersey with an onsite presence in Parsippany on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday.

﻿

\\*\\*Marketing Insights Analyst - Residential\\*\\*

﻿

\\*\\*Introduction\\*\\*

This role is part of a team that believes in supporting each other, striving for excellence, and contributing to meaningful work. The company fosters an environment where employees can lead in the present while shaping the future. Empowerment, teamwork, and innovation are central to its success.

﻿

\\*\\*Team Overview\\*\\*

The Insights Team is dedicated to understanding and advocating for customer needs, conducting research to support customer-led innovation, and driving strategic decision-making across products and experiences. The team collaborates closely with other business functions to deliver insights that inform design, product development, and marketing strategies.

﻿

\\*\\*Summary\\*\\*

The Marketing Insights Analyst - Residential will play a key role in understanding customer needs and supporting data-driven strategic decisions. Reporting to the Marketing Insights Manager, this role will oversee Market Research initiatives to influence product, brand, marketing, and customer programs. The ideal candidate is proactive, analytical, and curious, capable of managing multiple research projects simultaneously.

﻿

\\*\\*Essential Duties\\*\\*

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

﻿

- Manage and execute Marketing Insights projects from inception to completion, including defining methodologies, participant recruitment, survey development, data analysis, and presentation of findings.

- Develop and design research instruments such as questionnaires and discussion guides that align with business needs.

- Conduct qualitative research including focus groups, interviews, and user experience testing.

- Present actionable insights to business stakeholders to inform strategic decisions and product development.

- Organize and manage in-person customer insights events, ensuring valuable feedback is gathered for future strategy and product innovation.

- Maintain the insights knowledge management system and provide regular updates to ensure accessibility and usability across the organization.

﻿

\\*\\*Requirements\\*\\*

- 3-7 years of experience in marketing analytics, market research, user experience research, or management consulting.

- Bachelor’s degree or higher, ideally with a focus in a relevant field such as Marketing, Psychology, Research, or General Management.

- Advanced expertise in quantitative and qualitative research methodologies.

- Proficiency in Marketing Research tools such as Qualtrics and Usertesting.com.

- Strong facilitation, project management, and stakeholder management skills.

- Experience with Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.

- Experience in the building materials industry or similar complex industries is preferred.

﻿

\\*\\*Preferred Qualifications\\*\\*

- Certifications in Marketing Research, Customer Experience, or User Experience Research.

- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with solid business acumen.

- Demonstrated experience managing multiple research projects simultaneously.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $42.00 - $48.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Experience:

* SQL: 1 year (Preferred)
* Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Parsippany-Troy Hills, NJ 07054 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Parsippany-Troy Hills, NJ 07054: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

title: Advocate Counselor YABC Washington Irving
description:
**Job Opening:** Advocate Counselor

Mission Society of New York City improves the lives of children, youth, and families in the city’s most underserved communities. Through programs and services that respond to community needs, we create cycles of success for generations to come.  
Position Summary  
The *Level up Program* at the *Washington Irving Young Adult Borough Center (*YABC) provides academic,

social-emotional, post-secondary planning, and career-readiness counseling to YABC's students. YABC is an evening academic program designed specifically to meet the needs of high school students who might be considering dropping out because they are behind in meeting their graduation requirements or because they have adult responsibilities that make attending school in the daytime difficult.  
Title:  
Advocate Counselor  
Program:  
Washington Irving High School YABC  
Reports To: Supervises:  
Program Director

**Employment Status:** Full-Time Non-Exempt  
Basic Function:  
Provide comprehensive support services to program participants as required by the LTW program contract and appropriate to students’ needs. Outreach to students who fail to attend school.  
Duties and Responsibilities

* Establish a rapport with program participants.
* Provide attendance support and individual counseling on a monthly basis to caseload of program participants.
* Provide individual- and group-counseling focusing on post-secondary planning, social-emotional development, and career-readiness skills.
* Collaborate with other LTW and Department of Education staff to track student progress and attendance, develop individualized participant support plans, and conduct telephone, in-school, and home visit outreach.
* Input data in multiple databases in a timely manner.
* Identify participants educational and career goals and help them to develop post-secondary plan.
* Assist Internship Placement Specialist in matching participants to appropriate internship opportunities.
* Assist LTW Social Worker in providing crisis intervention services.
* Accompany participants on day- and overnight- trips to locations within and outside of New York State.
* Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

* Minimum of B.A. or B.S. degree
* Demonstrated interest in working with low-income students and/or students of color
* Knowledge of basic youth development principles
* Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment
* Detail oriented and capable of managing multiple simultaneous projects

**PREFERED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Ability to speak Spanish, Mandarin, Cantonese, or Arabic
* At least 2 years' experience working and providing counseling services to children and adolescents

General Requirements  
Staff is expected to be committed to the mission, vision, and values of Mission Society.  
Salary and Benefits  
Salary is $49,500 based on experience, qualifications and fit. Comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, life, long term disability insurance, voluntary 403(B) plan, TransitChek, Employee Wellness Program, Municipal Credit Union membership, voluntary supplemental insurance options.  
.  
Note: We are unable to accept phone calls. Applicants must meet qualifications stated above. Only applicants selected for further consideration will be contacted.  
*Mission Society of New York City is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $49,500.00 - $52,500.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: B2B Independent Sales Contractor - Advertising
description:
**Earn up to $20,000 per month selling advertising + sanitizing wipes from home as an independent sales contractor for Terraboost Media. sell**


We are looking for experienced **INDEPENDENT SALES CONTRACTORS** that desire an opportunity to make REAL MONEY, with unlimited income potential.


**Terraboost Media** is the largest retail media business in the United States and is looking for articulate, professional well-organized individuals to Recruit Companies and Business Professionals to Sponsor 1 or more of our 120,000 Wellness Kiosks that dispense HAND SANITIZER WIPES at the front entrance of CVS, RITE AID and many MAJOR SUPERMARKET CHAINS across America. Our company has the exclusive right to sell advertising/health & wellness sponsorships on jumbo wellness kiosks (billboards) that sit at the front door of prominent retailers. Since there’s only 1 advertisement that sits at the front-door of each retailer, there’s a natural urgency built into our product which will assist in your success and help you close business. We’ve been in business for 18 years and service over 120,000 kiosks nationwide.


We offer a great commission and bonus structure to our Independent Sales Contractors with weekly pay!


We're seeking individuals that are hungry, persistent, and looking for that once in a lifetime opportunity. **We want to talk to you NOW!**


Learn more about our company by visiting www.terraboost.com .


**Requirements:**


* Burning Desire to succeed.
* Hungry to Make money FAST.
* Have a computer and cell phone.
* **B2B experience selling over the phone, internet, or face-to-face.**
* **One-call-close experience is helpful.**
* **Advertising sales and cold calling experience preferred.**
* Results-oriented, well-organized individual.
* Proficient with technology and able to quickly learn new software.
* **Have consistent hours to invest in the opportunity.**


**Why Join Terraboost Media?**


High commissions, bonuses, and the freedom to work your own schedule from home or in your local community. We also provide our contractors with a great renewal program and weekly pay! You will receive product training with one of our best sales directors so we can get you selling immediately!

title: Risk Data Architect (Governance/Control)
description:
**Duration:** 6+ months, can be extended or converted to full-time employment

**Schedule:** Hybrid, 3 days onsite

**Location:** Midtown NY or Jersey City

**Rate:** C2C/1099 $820 / W2 $720 (Medical/Dental/Vision benefits available for W2)

**Risk Data Architect Consultant** 

Seeking an experienced Risk Data Architect Control and Governance specialist with 5+ years of financial industry experience to join the Risk Market Data team. The main focus of this position is data quality operation and control activities across market risk and counterparty risk.

This role serves as a subject matter expert and supports execution of a risk market data control program. This role is accountable for the daily risk data quality control and ongoing reporting, including implementation of a data control report framework and ongoing monitoring and remediation of any identified areas of weaknesses.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* Acting as the SME and liaising with front office, technology, and market and credit risk managers, and vendors to improve data governance framework.
* Responsible for carrying out the required control processes to support the data governance framework.
* Defining data standards, metrics, and measurement reporting approaches.
* Interface with IT**,** internal audit, and external vendors on Data Governance topics as appropriate.

**Qualifications:**

* Experience in market and finance data with a large financial institution.
* Experience in financial time series modeling and management
* Data quality business process improvement experience.
* Experience in complex regulatory projects.
* Strong technical understanding of data architecture, data quality, market risk, counterparty risk, derivative trade data and related technologies from a data quality management perspective.

**Skills:**

* Excellent presentation and communication skills with direct experience working with senior management and regulators.
* Strong coding skills. Proficient in Python, SQL and other tools related to data engineering.
* Strong complex project management skills.
* Experience identifying financial data quality problems and performing root cause analysis and formulating potential solutions.
* Ability to partner and collaborate with individuals at all levels in the organization.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $720.00 - $820.00 per day

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Python: 1 year (Required)
* SQL: 1 year (Required)
* Market & Counterparty Risk: 1 year (Required)
* Data Quality Management: 1 year (Required)
* Data governance: 1 year (Preferred)
* Derivative Trade Data: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10022 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10022: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10022

title: Director of Data Insights & Strategy
description:
**Company Description** **Who We Are**


We’re purpose-driven. With every ride, we aim to redefine health and happiness. It’s all about being more than a workout: SoulCycle is a mind-body-soul experience, built on community, love, respect, acceptance, and a lot of fun. It comes to life through the ride, the relationships, and the unparalleled hospitality. And all of that comes from our people. Join us—we’d love to have you

**Our Mission**


To foster an open, diverse, & inclusive community—while embracing each unique individual exactly as they are. We empower each other by listening with an open mind, finding ways to learn and grow together, and always nurturing a sanctuary of trust. To make a real, lasting impact, we’ll work nonstop to embrace and create change. Because nobody is equal until everyone is equal.

 **Job Description**  

SoulCycle is searching for someone passionate about data and the stories it can tell. If you have a mix of experience in analytics, business intelligence, data visualization and engineering processes, our team would love to hear from you. The ideal candidate has knowledge of the end-to-end stack behind reporting, a foundation of analytical and statistics knowledge, the ability to do pretty much anything in SQL, incredible attention to detail, and excitement when it comes to surfacing insights to leadership throughout our organization and driving results. This role reports into our VP of Finance, and will work closely with the Finance team as well as many other teams within the organization including the management team.  



**ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Provide insights and recommendations to the CEO, Management Team and other cross-functional teams to help make data-driven decisions and identify business opportunities
* Maintain and continue to build the foundation for the data infrastructure that supports all business functions, from marketing and operations to finance and customer experience
* Become a subject matter expert on all the data we have and how to use it, and contribute to the discussion as we develop new and improved ways to measure our business
* Visualizations and Dashboarding: design and develop ad-hoc and recurring Looker reports; create and monitor business metrics; identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for performance improvement
* Audit existing data infrastructure and identify areas of opportunity to consolidate data sources, dashboards and reports; identify and diagnose any data discrepancies or issues; ensure accuracy of reporting
* Work with technology team to improve and ensure that new and existing systems provide accurate, timely, and comprehensive data in a flexible, easy to access interface
* Partner with Data Engineering team to create additional efficiencies and unify sources of data
* Predictive Modeling: build foundation for models that forecast business outcomes, customer behavior, and other relevant metrics
* Lead and mentor a Data Analyst. Provide feedback, performance measurement, and coaching to grow strong talent to drive sustained impact at SoulCycle.

  

**Qualifications**  

* 6+ years of professional experience transforming and analyzing data across platforms such as Looker, Tableau, Mode, Jupyter Notebooks, Excel, and GCP/AWS.
	+ Looker/LookML experience is preferred.
* Ability to set a vision for a sustainable long-term data strategy while also contributing to daily tactical needs of the business
* Expert in SQL (able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets)
* Ability to identify patterns and trends in data and solve problems
* Experience in predictive modeling (e.g., regression analysis, machine learning)
* Excellent communication skills to work with CEO, Management Team, and other stakeholders to translate business needs and ideas into analyses and recommendations in a timely manner
* Top-notch organizational skills and project management skills; ability to manage multiple work streams and manage deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Creative problem solving skills to find solutions to vague questions

**COMPENSATION: $165k - 175k annual salary + bonus**

**#LI-SC**

 **Additional Information**  

For additional Information visit our Career Site: https://www.soul-cycle.com/careers/

title: Designated Consultant
description:
**Job position: Designated Consultant**

**Pay rate: $80 per hourLocation: New york CityDuties and Responsibilities**

* Assist the University Title IX Director in conducting proactive, unbiased, comprehensive and timely investigations into Title IX allegations, including gender-based violence and harassment and to ensure remediation of complaints when required under the Policy on Sexual Misconduct;
* Assist the University Title IX Director in managing the University adjudication and appeal process as outlined in the University’s Policy on Sexual Misconduct;
* Assist the University Title IX Director in managing the University’s online Sexual and Interpersonal Violence Prevention and Response training program for students, including training staff, revising curriculum, and overseeing campus compliance;
* Assist the University Title IX Director in collaborating with University stakeholders to effectuate campus climate surveys and develop policies, initiatives, and opportunities to increase awareness and improve services for campus groups (e.g., LGBTQI+, foster care students, international students, student leaders, and CCSD members);
* Assist the University Title IX Director in creating, facilitating, and delivering appropriate education and training as required by Title IX and New York State Education Law Article 129-A and 129-B ("Enough is Enough") for University and college stakeholders, including Title IX coordinators and investigators, members of the University’s Department of Public Safety, Student Affairs, and Human Resources professionals, and others who serve a role in the procedures set forth in the University’s Policy on Sexual Misconduct;
* Assist the University Title IX Director in responding to inquiries and requests from Title IX Coordinators and investigators and identifying appropriate external resources;
* Assist the University Title IX Director in updating university-wide templates used during the reporting, investigation, adjudication, and appeal stages of matters falling under the Policy on Sexual Misconduct; and
* Assist the University Title IX Director in monitoring university-wide compliance with Title IX, Enough is Enough, the New York State Model Sexual Harassment Policy, and the Policy on Sexual Misconduct.
* Assist the University Title IX Director in serving as the co-investigator for reports of sex discrimination or sexual misconduct in the event of a conflict of interest at a constituent school or college that requires the University Title IX Director to lead the investigation.

**Educational Background**

* **Relevant Degree**: A bachelor’s degree in a related field such as law, education, human resources, or social sciences. Advanced degrees (master's or higher) are often preferred.
* **Specialized Training**: Completion of Title IX-specific training or certification programs (e.g., from the Association of Title IX Administrators or similar organizations).

**Professional Experience**

* **Experience in Title IX**: At least 3-5 years of experience working with Title IX regulations, including experience in investigations, compliance, or legal matters related to Title IX.
* **Consulting Experience**: Prior experience as a consultant or in a similar advisory role is beneficial, particularly in educational institutions or organizations subject to Title IX.

**Knowledge and Skills**

* **Understanding of Title IX**: Comprehensive knowledge of Title IX regulations, enforcement, and compliance requirements, as well as related federal and state laws.
* **Investigative Skills**: Ability to conduct or guide investigations into complaints of discrimination, harassment, or sexual misconduct, including understanding due process and confidentiality issues.
* **Policy Expertise**: Experience in developing, reviewing, or advising on Title IX policies and procedures to ensure they meet legal and regulatory standards.
* **Training Capabilities**: Skills in creating and delivering training and educational programs related to Title IX for various stakeholders, including staff, students, and administrators.
* **Communication Skills**: Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively articulate complex legal and regulatory information to diverse audiences.
* **Analytical Skills**: Ability to analyze complex situations, interpret regulations, and provide practical advice and recommendations.

**Additional Qualities**

* **Ethical Standards**: A high level of integrity and professionalism, with a strong commitment to confidentiality and ethical practices.
* **Cultural Sensitivity**: Awareness of and sensitivity to issues related to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
* **Adaptability**: Flexibility to adapt to changes in regulations, institutional needs, and emerging issues in Title IX compliance.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $80.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10001 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10001: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Customer Relationship Manager
description:
Exciting Opportunity: Join us as a Full Time Customer Relationship Manager at Alay Home Care in Bayonne, New Jersey. This position offers the flexibility of working from home, allowing you to balance your professional and personal life effectively. You'll have the chance to showcase your customer service skills while making a meaningful impact on the lives of others in need of home health care services. With an annual salary of $45,760, you can grow both personally and professionally with us.


If you're hungry for a rewarding challenge and value integrity and safety in your work, apply today! You can enjoy great benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision, and Paid Time Off.

### **LET US INTRODUCE OURSELVES**


Alay Home Care is a DDD Provider established in 2018. Since opening, we have serviced over 300 consumers throughout New Jersey. We're devoted to supporting individuals with Developmental Disabilities by providing Direct Care Staff in the Home and Community Settings. Our team has been in the home care industry for over 22 years, consisting of a group of highly experienced and knowledgeable team members.

### **WHAT'S YOUR DAY LIKE?**

  

As a Customer Relationship Manager at Alay Home Care, you will be responsible for building and maintaining strong relationships with our clients and their families. Your day-to-day tasks will include answering inquiries, addressing concerns, coordinating care schedules, and ensuring client satisfaction. You will also collaborate with our care team to ensure seamless service delivery. This role requires excellent communication skills, empathy, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. A strong attention to detail and the ability to prioritize tasks efficiently are key to success in this position.


Embrace the opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of those we serve.

### **DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?**

  

To excel as a Customer Relationship Manager at Alay Home Care, you must possess the following skills and qualifications: - At least 3 years of Support Coordination Experience - 2 work references available for contact - Strong problem-solving and organizational skills - Excellent verbal and written communication abilities - Proficiency in using Google Apps (Gmail, Drive, Voice, Meet, Sheet, Docs, and Hangouts) - you must have access to a computer or laptop with internet connectivity, be willing to travel for work up to 50% of the time, own a reliable vehicle for fieldwork, and hold a valid Driver's License. Join us in providing exceptional home health care services while showcasing your skills and expertise in customer relations.

  

Knowledge and skills required for the position are:


Requirements:

+ Must have Computer or Laptop with internet access
+ Must be able to travel 50% work travel
+ Must have a reliable vehicle for field work
+ Must have a valid Driver's License


Qualifications:

+ Must have at least 3 years Support Coordination Experience
+ Must have 2 work references to contact
+ Strong problem solving and organizational skills
+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills
+ Must be proficient in using Google Apps (Gmail, Drive, Voice, Meet, Sheet Docs and Hangouts)

### **JOIN US!**


So, what do you think? If this sounds like the right position for you, go ahead and apply. Good luck!

title: Community Liason / Home Care Business Development Representative QUEENS
description:
**Full job description**

**About us:**

Home Family Care has been a trusted provider of comprehensive home care services for over 10 years, serving the diverse needs of clients across New York. Committed to enhancing the quality of life for our clients and their families, we offer personalized care solutions delivered with compassion, professionalism, and respect.

**Job Description:**  
As a Home Care Marketer at Home Family Care, you will play a pivotal role in expanding our reach and fostering relationships within the community. Your primary responsibility will be to promote our services to potential clients, healthcare professionals, and community organizations. You will be a key representative of our organization, advocating for our mission and values while driving growth and engagement.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement strategic marketing plans to generate leads and increase client referrals.
* Build and maintain relationships with healthcare professionals, hospitals, rehabilitation centers, assisted living facilities, and other referral sources.
* Conduct outreach activities, including networking events, health fairs, and community presentations, to raise awareness of Home Family Care.
* Collaborate with our community intake team to facilitate the intake process for new clients.
* Provide education and training sessions to healthcare professionals and community members on our services.
* Track marketing metrics and analyze data to assess the effectiveness of marketing strategies and campaigns.
* Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and market developments to identify opportunities for growth and innovation.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in marketing, sales, or business development, preferably in the healthcare or home care industry.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport with diverse population.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written.
* Self-motivated with a results-oriented mindset and a passion for making a positive impact.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including paid time off.
* Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
* Supportive and collaborative work environment with a focus on employee well-being and work-life balance.

title: Early Childhood Teacher
description:
**Are You Looking to Unleash Your Teaching Passion? We Want to Meet You!**

  

Do you have a genuine desire to positively impact the lives of young children? We are seeking individuals with an unwavering passion for providing children with an exceptional early learning experience and the energy, compassion, and drive to execute it.

  

We are seeking individuals with an unwavering passion for providing children with exceptional early learning education, and are full of **energy**, **compassion**, and a genuine **love** for impacting the lives of children.  



  

Whether you have spent time in childcare before or are new to the industry, we are seeking candidates who are **dedicated to nurturing young minds.** There is a special place for you at The Village Learning Center in Pennington, NJ -part of the Early Learning Academies (ELA) community!

 **What We Offer**

* Competitive pay
* Professional Development Opportunities
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* Paid holidays, vacation, and personal time
* Monday-Friday **No nights or weekends!**
* **Employee childcare discount**
* A supportive and collaborative work environment

 **What We Need from You:**

**Education, Experience, and Training Qualifications**

* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* Background check.
* Must meet all state, federal, and Early Learning Academies guidelines regarding education, experience, immunizations, employment physical, and required health and safety training and practices.
* A valid driver's license is required if driving is a requirement of the position.

 **Ready to Join Us?** If you are ready to be a part of a welcoming and inspiring educational community that values innovation and creativity and is ready to shape the future of young learners, we cannot wait to meet you!  



  

***Early Learning Academies (ELA) is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.***

title: Server - FT
description:
**Allegro**, Voted Great Place to Work! At Allegro Senior Living we are committed to being a premier senior living operator, placing people at the center of everything we do. Our pledge to offer the highest quality of service begins with our commitment to finding qualified team members who share our passion for providing an inspiring level of care and service. We cultivate a supportive and flexible working environment that motivates and empowers our team members to meet and exceed our residents expectations. The only thing missing is YOU!


The primary responsibility of the **Server** is to accommodate residents and guests during their dining experience by attending to their needs in a friendly, timely, and professional manner.


**Areas of Responsibility**

* Greet and seat residents and guests in a timely and professional manner as well as approach and interact with residents and guests in a friendly, service-oriented, and professional manner.
* Serve food in an efficient and professional manner.
* Clear tables of glasses, silverware, dishes, etc. when residents and guests have finished a course or their meal according to Company protocol.
* Maintain a clean dining room. Chairs, windows, floors, and all work areas should be wiped down and sanitized after every meal period.
* Deliver and retrieve trays to and from residents apartments as needed.
* Label and date all food.
* Other job duties as assigned see full job description.

**Required Qualifications**

* Must be a minimum of 16 years of age.
* Must pay attention to detail, be flexible/adaptable, have safety awareness, and be a team player.
* Must havepositive Criminal Background Screening.
* The Community is a drug free workplace; associates are subject to adherence to the Company Drug Free Workplace policy.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Food serving experience preferred.

**Perks & Benefits**

* Competitive Pay
* Affordable Health Insurance Plans
* Life Insurance and Disability Plans
* 401(k) Retirement Savings
* Time off Benefits
* Associate Recognition and Anniversary Awards
* Employee Assistance Program
* Associate & Resident Referral Bonus Program
* Associate Satisfaction Surveys
* Fun Work Environment!

*Love Management Company, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.*

title: Narcotics Pharmacy Technician- Onsite/ Paid Training w/ Benefits (Thurs-Mon 6am-2:30pm) Hiring Now!
description:
PharmScript is one of the nation's leading pharmacies, partnering with long-term and post- acute care facilities to supply medications to thousands of residents and patients. When you join the PharmScript family, you join the ranks of more than 2,000 dedicated people across the country who help to get safe, accurate, and timely medication to those who need it most.

We're looking for a Pharmacy Technician 1 to join our PharmScript team within our Floor Technician department. As a Pharmacy Technician 1, you’ll support the on-site pharmacist to prepare prescription orders for facilities. You’ll be responsible for ensuring that pharmacy standards are maintained, policies are carried out and objectives are accomplished. The ideal candidate is a people person who enjoys troubleshooting and resolving problems and is dedicated to helping customers. For you, no task feels too small and no challenge impossible. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential.

Responsibilities:

* Assisting the Pharmacist with proper labeling and filling prescriptions
* Accurately preparing prescriptions under the Pharmacist’s supervision
* Packaging Rx labels with an in-depth understanding of Framework system
* Packaging medications in bottles or bingo cards for dispensing and for delivery
* Restocking and organizing the pharmacy shelves (Drugs, supplies, etc.)
* Removing out of date items from inventory/shelves
* Refilling offsite inventory boxes with emergency medications.
* Basic operation of pharmacy automation (Accuflex, Dosis, E2, etc.)
* Replenishing Tharo and Zebra labels and maintaining other various pharmacy equipment
* Other duties set by management

Qualifications:

* High school diploma or GED is required
