title: Product Operations Manager
description:
Hi, we're Oscar. We're hiring a Product Operations Manager to join our Product Operations team.



Oscar is the first health insurance company built around a full stack technology platform and a focus on serving our members. We started Oscar in 2012 to create the kind of health insurance company we would want for ourselves—one that behaves like a doctor in the family.

  


### **About the role**



The Product Operations team unlocks Oscar's ability to ship more products faster and better, which is critical to Oscar's overall mission to use technology and design to refactor healthcare. The primary function of Product Operations is to execute and continuously improve processes leading up to product launch, as well as ongoing processes that have not been automated.



As a Product Operations Manager, you will partner closely with Product team members, Engineering, business teams, external partners, and other stakeholders within the Claims domain. This domain's scope includes claims infrastructure, front-end Claims management software, a payments processing UI, and configuration of the claims adjudication pipeline.



You will report to the Senior Product Operations Manager.


**Work Location:**



Oscar is a blended work culture where everyone, regardless of work type or location, feels connected to their teammates, our culture and our mission.



This is a hybrid role in our New York City office. You will work part of the time in the office and part of the time remote / work-from-home. #LI-Hybrid

  


**Pay Transparency:**



The base pay for this role is: $119,200 - $156,450 per year. You are also eligible for employee benefits, participation in Oscar's unlimited vacation program, company equity grants and annual performance bonuses.

  


### **Responsibilities**


* Owns the execution of key product delivery processes and/or broader initiatives that scale and mature Oscar's Technology teams.
	+ Product delivery processes include: feature launches, bug triage and resolution, quality assurance (QA) planning and execution, and building/maintaining product and stakeholder feedback loops. Prioritizes processes within scrum teams to accomplish, improve, scale, and execute.
	+ Broader initiatives impact multiple pods and may include roadmap administration, team productivity analysis and/or defining templates. Responsible for Collaborating with stakeholders to identify process improvements and partnering with business leaders and other stakeholders to develop and execute against a project plan for successful socialization and roll out.
* Build and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders including, Product Management, Design, Engineering, and Data Science, to support effective collaboration and discovery of solutions to deliver on department programs and objectives.
* Independently analyze data and workflows to identify opportunities for process improvement.
* Design and implement process improvements that improve efficiency and quality.
* Create and maintain documentation to make processes sustainable and scalable.
* Apply project management strategies to ensure tasks are completed timely. When projects are not on track, proactively socialize required support with appropriate stakeholders to ensure outcomes can be met.
* Monitor success metrics to ensure applications and/or processes are meeting their KPIs.
* Compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
* Other duties as assigned.

  


### **Qualifications**


* 3+ years of experience working in a cross-functional role in technology or operations.
* 3+ years of experience working directly with engineers and designers.
* 2+ years experience working directly with engineering scrum teams.
* 3+ years of experience with common project management tools such as Jira or Monday.com.
* 1+ years of SQL experience (equivalent technical experience is considered commensurate).

### **Bonus Points**


* 5+ years of experience working in a cross-functional role in technology or operations.
* Experience proactively and independently identifying opportunities for improvements in process and execution, with a proven track record of implementing changes effectively.
* Demonstrated ability to act with high levels of independence and accountability during identification, scoping, and execution of process improvements.
* Experience navigating multiple stakeholders with competing priorities and making tradeoff decisions for your own work.
* Demonstrated ability to quickly ramp up to new subject matter and technical concepts
* Experience using qualitative and quantitative insights to clarify decisions wherever possible.
* Strong communication skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and proactively with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure timely progress on initiatives and effective management of risks and dependencies

description:

title: Security Guard
description:
**Job description**

**Performs general security work in the protection of persons, property, and the enforcement of all applicable policies, rules and regulations of WHMC. Patrols hospital buildings and grounds to prevent fire, theft, and vandalism. Secures, unlocks and protects hospital buildings and grounds. Responds to security needs of Hospital personnel.**

**\\* Patient Restraint**

**\\* Patrols buildings and grounds of hospital to prevent fires, theft and vandalism.**

**\\* Inspect doors, locks and windows to determine level of security**

**\\* Escort staff, patients, visitors to their parked cars or public transportation when request.**

**\\* Conduct thorough investigation of incidents reported by hospital personnel, patients and visitors.**

**\\* Writes incident reports and documents investigatory steps and results**

**\\* Responds to emergency calls for assistance to control disorderly conduct or combative patients, visitors or staff.**

**\\* Patrol parking areas to detect any irregularities.**

**\\* Document the opening of any door or area in or around the hospital.**

**\\* Inspects outgoing parcels as necessary to prevent theft of hospital property.**

**\\* Report all safety and fire hazards observed on routine patrols and inspections**

**\\* Performs all other duties as required.**

**Position Requirements:**

\\* T**his position requires a minimum formal education of High School Diploma or equivalent and a minimum of 3 years job-related experience.**

**\\* Experience Desired (not required) criteria include: 3 years experience law enforcement/security.**

title: Special Inspector
description:
Project Tactical Solutions, LLC (PTS) is a Special Inspection Agency in New York City that provides reliable, responsive and service solutions to our customers. We are staffed by qualified professional engineers whose primary focus is on life safety, construction quality oversight and regulatory compliance. PTS provides Special Inspection services specifically geared toward the New York City Construction Industry. Our Inspectors are qualified to perform over a full range of inspections to meet our client and project needs. The services we provide are subdivided into the following disciplines: Architectural, Structural, Mechanical, Fire Protection and Energy Code.

We are currently seeking a full time Inspector with 3 to 5 years of experience to join our growing staff. The ideal candidate shall be ambitious and highly motivated with an interest in developing and implementing procedures and standards for special inspections.

Job Description and Responsibilities:

· Conduct various types of inspections and testing as per the Codes and Regulation set forth by the NYC Department of Buildings

· Observe / document field construction for compliance with approved drawings, shop drawings, specifications, and applicable building codes

· Responsible for maintaining current and accurate daily field logs

· Prepare detailed inspection reports following all field visits and issue in a timely manner

· Manage the timely preparation, review and issuance of Field Reports from all Associate Inspectors

· Work under the direct supervision of Professional Engineers

Requirements / Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Architecture

· Concrete and Steel certification preferred

· ACI credentials recommended

· Familiarity with NYC DOB construction industry codes

· Strong attention to detail, high level of accuracy and ability to multitask and prioritize workload

· Self-motivated, flexible with ability to work independently as well as part of a team of Engineering / Construction Professionals

· Ability to communicate clearly with colleagues and clients of all levels, both written and oral

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Special Inspection: 3 years (Required)

title: Associate, Finance Park Programs (Part Time)
description:
**About Us:**  
Junior Achievement of New York (JA New York) an affiliate of Junior Achievement USA, is the leading non- profit organization in Greater New York dedicated to creating pathways to economic empowerment for young people. Our mission is to teach and inspire young people to understand the economic world around them, plan for their financial futures, and make the most of their potential. JA New York is a growing organization that is committed to developing talent and building a diverse, high performing, and successful team.

**About Finance Park:**

After learning in the classroom, students put their skills to work by visiting JA Finance Park®, an immersive on-site facility, where students engage with volunteers and put into practice what they’ve learned by developing a personal budget. A Finance Park is run by JA staff, volunteers from the corporate sector, along with some members from the Brooklyn community.

***Primary Job Responsibilities:***

* Work with JA Finance Park team to implement a fun and engaging experience for volunteers, students and teachers
* Manage onsite engagement of up to 50-70 students per day by facilitating daily activities, coordinating daily simulation schedule and other logistics to ensure completion of simulation
* Facilitate onsite volunteer training daily (60-90 minutes) and provide guidance throughout the simulation to 10-20 volunteers to help them coach students by applying their personal experiences within the simulation
* Help with daily set up of JA Finance; i.e. set up tables, chairs, set up JA Finance Park computers/tablets, worksheets, and other necessary materials
* Monitor and support volunteers and students to ensure high-quality experience by JA Finance Park attendees
* Assist with collecting and submitting all JA Finance Park paperwork including volunteer registration form, student permission slips, student pre and post-test surveys, verification reports and other ancillary documents
* Assist in the inventory tracking for all simulation resources (tablets, props, program materials, etc.)
* Deliver a consistent, high-quality, high-energy experience every day during the school year (approx. 175 days)

***Required Competencies:***

* Currently pursuing or completed Associate or Bachelor’s Degree
* Evidence of very strong oral communication/presentation skills
* Desire to work in a youth-oriented non-profit organization
* Superior organizational and project management skills
* Ability to troubleshoot and do well under pressure
* Ability to work in a team setting

**Schedule**: October – June (JA Finance Park is also closed from approx. mid-December – mid-January; July hours may be available)

3 to 4 days a week; 8:00am – 2:00/2:30pm (schedule is flexible, depending on your schedule)

**Location:** 230 W. 38th Street, New York, NY, 10018

***Interested candidates should apply by submitting a resume, cover letter, and related information to:*** **myoussef@jany.org**

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:** The physical demands described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to: sit, walk, occasionally required to reach with hands and arms, continually required to talk or hear, occasionally required to bend, lift, or climb, frequently required to lift and carry light weights (25-50 pounds), and specific vision abilities include: close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust or focus.

\\*This position description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related duties as requested by their supervisor. This document does not create an employment contract implied or otherwise, other than an ‘at-will’ relationship.

title: Peer Specialist - ISL017 - Sun 8AM-4PM, Mon-Wed 4PM-8PM
description:
**Position Summary:** **The Peer Specialist will provide direct mental health services to recipients participating in rehabilitation and recovery services within PSCH Inc. The Peer Specialist will perform a range of tasks which are designed to assist recipients in regaining personal control over their lives and over their own recovery processes. These tasks focus on facilitating the development of self-help skills, support systems, coping strategies, and increased hope and self-esteem that are central to recovery from a psychiatric disability. Peer Specialists model competence and the possibility of recovery. This position may have supervised / unsupervised contact and or conversational interaction with consumers while working in the residences, day treatments and habilitation facilities.**


**Essential Accountabilities:**
===============================


Provide direct care services to consumer, including planning and implementation of goals and training, which will develop and enhance activities of daily living skills. These include but are not limited to:


a) Budgeting


b) Grooming


c) Nutritional planning


d) Use of public transportation/travel training


e) Use of community resources/community integration


f) Shopping/menu planning


g) Housekeeping


h) Sexual development/socialization skills


i) Physical health maintenance


j) Assertiveness/self-advocacy training


Monitor consumers progress. Tasks essential to those duties include, but are not limited to: seeing, hearing and observing consumers, performing manual tasks, reading and writing (documentation, lifting, climbing and descending stairs, traveling, boarding and utilize public transportation (bus, subway) use of telephone to make and receive calls.


Responsible to coordinate evacuation and ensure consumers safety in emergency situations (i.e., fires, fire drills). Tasks essential to these duties are the ability to exit in emergencies, which may require the ability to climb and descend fire escapes and assist others to do the same.


Responsible for all necessary written documentation including Functional assessments; initialed and updated, progress notes and quarterly service plans.


**Essential Accountabilities (Continued):**


Assist consumers in planning and coordination of recreational/social activities. At times this may require escorting consumers to these activities and/or participate in moderate physical activities as part of this task.


Knowledge of coping skills for dealing with symptoms of various psychiatric disabilities.


Advocate for recipients and negotiate with service providers.


Travel to and from different sites and assist recipients with traveling training.


Verbally engage and empathize with consumers based on common experiences.


Assist consumers in identifying community supports and facilitating linkages.


Participate in activities of other staff members in their absence or during periods of staff shortage.


If deemed necessary must be able to participate in these programs at various sites and varying times. The ability to complete the following training offered and perform the techniques taught in each area a required function of the position; CPR/First Aid, Medication Supervision, Cultural Competence, CPI, TIP-42, Motivational Interviewing, and Suicide Assessment and Prevention.


Represent the agency at meetings, trainings not otherwise specified.


Ability to work flexible schedule as work schedule and locations are subject to change.


Maintain confidentiality at all times.


This does not limit the assignment of duties or exclude the performance of other duties not mentioned, as assigned by supervisor.

**Demonstrated interpersonal communication skills and the ability to empathize with, relate to and effectively work with recipients of mental health services. Life experience with mental health or substance abuse history.**
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

**AND**

  

Two years of active participation in mental health self-help activities, peer support or peer advocacy programs, or recipient run organizations or similar experiences or programs. High school diploma or GED and drivers license required.

title: Math Teacher - Montvale
description:
**Teacher**


Hourly Pay Range: $21 - $30

**About C2 Education**


At C2 Education, we believe in our students and their potential for greatness. We change lives every day by helping students achieve their academic goals so they may attend the college of their dreams.


C2 Education is a leading organization made up of over 115 centers, in over 10 states. We are leaders in our field providing both in-person and virtual tutoring options customized to meet each students unique academic and personal needs. We have been helping students get accepted into their first-choice colleges since 1997. In the last five years, C2 Education students received 25,000+ dream college acceptances and over $180 million in scholarship offers.

**Why Join our Team**


As an employee of C2 Education you will be living out our mission, vision, and values. This provides you with a chance to enhance not only your life but the lives of the students you work with.


Pay ranges from $21 - $30 per hour depending on multiple factors, including specific location, individuals knowledge, skills, and experience.


In addition to the competitive pay, this role offers part-time benefits, including:

* 401K plus 4% employer contribution after first year of employment.
* Paid initial training and ongoing training.
* All benefits are subject to applicable plan documents and policies.

**Responsibilities**


Our teachers work in small groups with students at a 3 student to one teacher ratio. C2 Education offers teachers strong administrative and leadership support so they can focus solely on what matters: tutoring students. Our Center Directors and District Managers for each center take care of the scheduling and communication with parents.

* Tutor students in small groups (3 students max).
* Tailor C2 Educations proprietary curriculum on SAT, ACT, AP, and school subjects to students needs.
* Track and analyze student progress.
* Perform team-based activities as needed.

**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelors Degree (B.A./B.S.).
* Ability to tutor in-person.
* Score at the 95th percentile on our diagnostic SAT, AP, or ACT test.
* Excited about working with families and students to achieve their goals.
* Eligible to work in the US.
* A clear background check.
* Strong passion for education.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* AP-level knowledge in at least one or more subjects.
* Previous teaching experience highly desired. No teacher certification or licensure necessary.


The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the priorities, skills and abilities required to do the job.C2 Education provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, military or veterans status, genetics or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition to federal law requirements, C2 Education complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has operations. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: Grants Manager
description:
**GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES**


The Contract and Grants Manager for the Town of Fairfield reports to the Chief Fiscal Officer and oversees the three major roles of grant work: Identification, Application, and Reporting & Compliance. The Contract and Grants Manager coordinates, develops, processes, and oversees grant application and management, while working closely with department heads, Capital Projects Team, and Operational Management Teams to develop grant proposals and budgets that align with organizational goals and meet funder priorities.


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Proactively researches, identifies, and secures grants from various funding sources; creates compelling proposals with persuasive language; ensures compliance with grant requirements and deadlines
* Reviews, prepares, and submits grant applications on behalf of the Town of Fairfield
* Monitors the budgetary and financial aspects of grant use for compliance
* Provides leadership, guidance and training in the planning, coordination, and implementation of grant processes to ensure the quality of grant proposals, reports, and grant-related documentation
* Ensures prompt reporting and compliance to grant or contract terms/conditions
* Supports the Finance team in preparation of accountability reports and oversight administration of grant funds
* Monitors grant administration for compliance and related performance indicators as well as creating tracking processes for quality standards and reporting
* Develops, updates, and implements policies and procedures relating to grant administration and grant management
* Performs research including needs analysis, literature review and regulations critique to identify problems and determine priorities
* Prepares contracts and agreements related to grant activities
* Monitors use of grant monies awarded to the Town to ensure compliance with the Town’s Grant Policy, as well as adherence to all terms and conditions of the grant; facilitates direct grant process
* Collaborates with leaders and team members to compile necessary information and documents
* Shares funding opportunities with relevant department heads and gathers feedback regarding the Town’s eligibility and feasibility of grants
* Develops and maintains a database of grants including funding source, status, deadlines, and compliance requirements
* Attends meetings of appropriate state, local and regional boards, commissions and/or organizations and performs other liaison functions to coordinate efforts in program areas
* Performs other related duties as required.

 **KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES**

* Ability to act with integrity, honesty, transparency and accountability
* Ability to maintain confidentiality, tact and diplomacy
* Ability to work and be flexible with regard to environment and people
* Ability to work independently with very limited supervision, as well as within a team environment
* Ability to develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders
* Ability to work in a result-oriented manner, within tight deadlines
* Ability to research and identify potential sources for funding through industry contacts, websites, service lists, etc.
* Thorough understanding of grant funding policies, procedures, and applicable local, state and federal rules and regulations
* Ability to present before Boards and Commissions
* Ability to work in an organized and meticulous manner while prioritizing work and resources
* Ability to successfully secure and manage multiple grants simultaneously
* Ability to effectively manage administrative and/or supervisory level personnel
* Strong analytical and budgeting skills; ability to interpret financial data and prepare budgets and financial grant reports
* Ability to demonstrate critical writing skills
* Ability to perform in a courteous and professional manner at all times
* Ability to communicate succinctly and professionally, both orally and in writing
* Proficiency in computer software and report writing skills

**Qualifications**
------------------


**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* **Required:** Minimum of 3 years of related work experience; demonstrated knowledge of relevant federal and state grants programs; proficiency in critical writing; proficiency with Microsoft Office software and necessary technology to meet the job functions of the position.
* **Preferred:** Bachelor's/Master’s Degree in the areas of business administration, project management, finance, law or related fields with a strong background in grant management and other related administrative functions.

**PAY RANGE**

* Salary Grade 8
**AFFILIATION**

* Member of PETA Collective Bargaining Unit, FLSA Exempt
 **THE TOWN OF FAIRFIELD IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**


It is the policy of the Town of Fairfield to ensure equal employment opportunity for all employees and to prohibit unlawful discrimination because of race, color, religion, creed, age, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation or physical and mental disability.

title: Low Voltage Technician & Estimator
description:
At Techworks, we believe in the **“right person, right seat”**. Currently we are looking for an experienced **Low Voltage Technician & Estimator** to join our Infrastructure division. This is an integral field services position focusing on our clients' physical network infrastructure, as well as the installation and maintenance of various physical security products including building access control and surveillance solutions. **Are you the right person for this seat?**

**What Techworks is looking for in our ideal candidate:**

* Ability to quickly learn and familiarize yourself with our standards and solutions in order to demonstrate both internal and customer-facing expertise.
* Facilitate new hardware deployments from design through implementation.
* Have experience working in a managed services delivery environment and a history of utilizing both helpdesk ticketing systems and remote management tools.
* Must be organized and able to accurately document work with an ability to run assignments from start to finish in timely manner.
* Adherence to our Core Values; a commitment to being ethical, accountable, independently motivated, and dedicated to learning.

**Primary Job Responsibilities**:

* Act as an In-the-Field resource for infrastructure projects, onsite equipment troubleshooting, and new equipment deployments
* Evaluate our clients' requests for networking, security, and surveillance solutions and estimate installation hours based on in-person site surveys.
* Take responsibility for constructing baseline quotes and solution proposals, consulting with our internal sales and account teams to revise and formalize.
* Show proficiency and pride in the planning and physical installation of structured cabling.
* Coordinate and direct junior team members during the completion of multi-resource jobs.
* Demonstrate an understanding of basic networking principles and perform on-site network and system troubleshooting as needed.
* Display professionalism and confidence in a prominent client-facing work role.
* Possess a valid driver's license as travel to client sites will be required, as necessary.

**Our Requirements:**

* Physical infrastructure knowledge with a proficiency in running, terminating, and repairing end-to-end network cabling.
* Experience with the installation and configuration of physical security products, including, but not limited to, Environmental Monitoring, Alarm & Surveillance Systems, and Access Control systems.
* Experience with Router / Switch / Wireless installation, configuration, and general troubleshooting.
* Availability to provide excellent customer service during normal business hours, Monday through Friday with some after hours as required
* Commitment to strong communication both internally and externally
* Strong troubleshooting, diagnostic, and real-world problem-solving abilities
* Strong organizational skills including detailed time entry and documentation
* Experience with RMM tools such as Automate, Kaseya, Continuum, or similar is a plus
* Experience with ConnectWise or similar ticketing system is a plus
* Eagerness to learn
* Reliable transportation and a valid driver's license
* Willing to travel for large projects
* Ability to lift 50lbs
* Must be willing to submit to background check

**Compensation includes**:

* Competitive Salary
* Full Time Employees enjoy an excellent benefits package including: 100% Employer Funded Health Insurance, Dental Plan, Vision Plan, Disability, Life Insurance, 401k with Employer Match, Paid Time Off, and Holiday Pay
* Growth and advancement opportunities available

title: Youth Soccer Coach
description:
**SOCCER SHOTS NEW YORK CITY CENTRAL**

**Company Profile:**

Soccer Shots is the leader in youth soccer development. Our nationally recognized program offers a high energy, fun, age-appropriate introduction to the wonderful game of soccer. Our innovative curriculum emphasizes both soccer skills and character development. Our goal is simple: to leave a lasting, positive impact on every child we serve.

**SOCCER SHOTS COUS:**

Soccer Shots COUS (COUS) was established in 2010. COUS covers the regions of DC, Maryland, Northern Virginia, Miami, FL, New York City Central, NY, and Nashville, TN. Soccer Shots New York City stretches from Manhattan to Brooklyn. COUS works closely with Soccer Shots Franchising national headquarters in Middletown, PA.

**THE JOB:**

Looking for part time work where you can make a positive impact in your community? Become a Soccer Shots Coach!

Soccer Shots blends soccer, education, and fun into high energy 30-minute sessions to kids ages 2-8 throughout the Manhattan and Brooklyn area. You’ll laugh. You’ll break a sweat. And you’ll go home at the end of the day knowing that you made a difference. It may be tough but coaching our children will be one of most rewarding things you ever do.

Apply today to be our friend and their hero.

**WHAT YOU GET:**

* Compensation: $25 per hour
* Flexible hours
* Career opportunities
* Great environment
* Leadership Training

**REQUIREMENTS:**

The ideal instructor MUST meet the following criteria:

* Prior soccer experience is not required. We only require the passion for positively impacting children’s lives through the love of sports and fitness.
* Prior experience working with children is preferred, formal or informal
* Must be at least 18 years of age

**HOW TO APPLY:** Visit our Careers Page on *www.soccershots.org*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

* Are you over the age of 18?
* I understand I may be required to carry a 30lb bag with soccer equipment for an extended period of time to and from my working sites.
* Please list the days of week (Monday-Sunday) and hours you are available to work between 8:45am - 7:00pm.
* Please describe your experience working with children.

Work Location: On the road

title: Regional Loss Prevention Manager
description:
Our Story
We make modern classics with character. We believe in true timelessness, the integrity of well-made clothes, and since our inception, great quality at a great price. That’s in our DNA.
But, we know it’s not only about the clothes—it’s about the *feeling* it gives the people who wear them*,* whether they’re confidently giving a presentation in a well-tailored suit; basking in long salty beach days in vibrant, colorful sun-soaked swimsuits, or joyfully re-discovering their favorite Rollneck sweater in their closet again and again, season after season.
And ultimately, it’s about helping our customers be the best, most authentic versions of themselves.
And *that’s* what we’re after, to inspire people’s lives and style.
Our dedication to Diversity, Equity, Belonging & Sustainability has been celebrated with industry recognition, reflecting our commitment to fostering an inclusive and sustainable workplace.
Responsibilities:* Responsible for ensuring all company directed shortage and safety programs are implemented and executed within scope of responsibility.
* Responsible for the training, development, and overall performance of direct reports.
* Responsible for developing the field organization in Loss Prevention through training, communication, and awareness programs.
* Organize and facilitate Loss Prevention training for all levels of the field organization within your scope of responsibility.
* Communicate and execute company target store / shortage reduction programs.
* Work with business partners to ensure all aspects of Loss Prevention are integrated into the daily operations of the stores.
* Assess region needs to ensure Loss Prevention resources (CCTV, EAS, manpower) are properly deployed.
* Responsible for ensuring losses of company assets are prevented, investigated, and resolved timely.
* Conduct investigations and interviews for inventory, cash loss, and breach of company policies and procedures.
* Proactively monitor controls to identify external/internal theft through the utilization of POS exception reporting tools.
* Resolve Open Talk Hotline Calls within a timely manner.
* Manage monthly Travel & Expense budgets.
* Assist in the creation of action plans to achieve operational compliance.
* Work closely with management to communicate and train operational standards.
* Offer recommendations and solutions in crisis situations such as workplace violence, protest, and demonstrations.
* Communicate all safety related policies using all available communication vehicles.


Qualifications:* Excellent communication, verbal and written, skills are required.
* Excellent time management and ability to prioritize / multitask.
* Proficient in conducting investigations and integrity interviews.
* Basic knowledge of computer applications; ex: excel, word, and Power point.
* Wicklander or Reid interviewing and integration certification preferred.
* 3-5 years of multi store retail Loss Prevention management experience preferred.
* Ability to travel to stores within assigned area, and maneuver around sales floors, stock room and offices.
* Regional Loss Prevention Manager must be able to work for periods at a desk on a computer.
* Bachelor’s Degree required.

title: Concrete Dispatcher / Concrete Logistics Coordinator
description:
**Who are we?** 

Seville Central Mix Corporation, also known as Seville Ready Mix, is a union concrete ready-mix supplier based in Queens and Long Island. It operates at several locations in the metropolitan area. Seville was established in the 1980s and continues to be family owned and operated.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and We Encourage the Diversification of our Workplace and Projects

**Who are you?** 

You are a motivated person with a passion for concrete, construction, and logistics. You thrive in fast-paced settings and are tech-savvy. You're seeking a position with a growing company that offers advancement opportunities.

**Responsibilities** 

* Dispatching trucks.
* Scheduling deliveries.
* Providing customer service to drivers and clients.
* Inbound/outbound sales calls.
* Monitor mixer and pump truck status on a constant basis to ensure customer satisfaction and maximum equipment and labor utilization
* Work closely with Plant Managers, Mixer Drivers, Pump Operators, Area Managers and Dispatch Manager to schedule trucks and jobs based upon hours of service per DOT laws
* Answer multi-line phone system and interact with customers to field complaints, quote prices, process orders, and provide information about our products and services
* Accuracy, attention to detail and the ability to multi-task is essential, as this is a fast-paced position in a busy office environment
* Must be proficient at entering customer order information into the computer while talking to the customer on the phone
* Schedules orders to ensure timely deliveries
* Complete all paperwork in its entirety and forward as applicable
* Must exercise discretion, as position requires the handling of confidential information
* Assist other team members as necessary
* Work safely, wear proper personal protective equipment as necessary
* Notify manager of any work-related injuries or accidents immediately
* Perform multiple tasks under stressful situations over long periods of time while maintaining proper composure
* Other duties and tasks as assigned or as necessary

**Qualifications** 

* Valid Drivers License
* The successful candidate will have at least a High School education or equivalent, although a college education is preferred.
* This person needs to have excellent and clear communication skills
* Be well-organized.
* Have strong customer service skills.
* Able to multi- task in a fast-paced environment all while maintaining a positive attitude while working with customers and other team members
* Must be able to work long and flexible hours as necessary.
* Ability to work at 7a.m. - 4:30p.m. but has flexibility for outside and overtime hours as needed
* Ability to work at least 2 or 3 Saturdays per month
* Must be able to quickly adapt to changes and be capable of making decisions while under pressure
* Dispatching experience is a plus.

title: Patient Liaison
description:

**JOB SUMMARY**

The primary function of this position is to ensure our patients receive the ultimate patient experience from the appointment request until the day of service and beyond. Respect for privacy and a love of customer service are required.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Provides a welcoming and supportive environment for all people entering assigned areas.

title: Director of Human Resources
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:**

Plans, organizes and directs a variety of complex administrative, technical and professional work of the human resources functions of the Agency. The Director of HR will manage staffing and recruiting, designing systems and developing policies and procedures for organizational development, employee satisfaction, including compensation and benefit systems, employee development and training, performance management, policy administration/compliance, and labor/employee relations. The Director of Human Resources is responsible for the overall performance of the HR department. The HR Director will serve as an advisor to the Administrator and Governing Authority regarding the HR management in the Agency.

**QUALIFICATION:**

- Bachelor Degree in Human Resources, Business, or Health Related Field required. Master’s Degree preferred.

- Minimum of 2-5 years of Human Resource/Administrative Experience

- Must be able to work independently as well as in a team environment and possess a strong work ethic.

- Be proficient in the use of automated equipment including word processing (Microsoft Word), spreadsheets, database application, and various client management systems.

- Fluent in Russian and English

- Must be able to lead the Department and have excellent interpersonal skills

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

- Manages and supervises human resources department to achieve goals within available resources; plans and organizes workloads and staff assignments

- Develop a system compliance program to execute and monitor compliance with regulatory aspects of healthcare delivery

- Work closely with Administration to identify and evaluate growth opportunities and other strategic alliances and /or contracts

- Develop, interpret, coordinate and communicate policies on human resources, internal controls and auditing

- Ensure compliance with closing calendar, planning deadlines and reporting requirements

- Facilitate agency–wide strategic planning, business prioritization and resource allocation processes

- Communicate Human Resources information to the Governing Authority and collaborate with Administration regarding the business strategy

- Analyze and interpret data and develop clear and informative methods to present Human Resources information

- Conduct meeting with the staff to ensure compliance with established practices, and keep employees aware of current standards and changes that are occurring within the Agency

- Organize and maintain an effective system of Human Resources

- Maintain professional growth and development through seminars, workshops, and professional affiliations to keep abreast of latest industry trends

- Participate in committee meeting as required

- Help design and implement performance measurements and support process change improvement

- Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein

**INTERPERSONAL AND TEAM SKILLS:**

- Assists other employees where needed.

- Is responsible and cooperative with supervisors, fellow employees, clients, and families.

- Maintains friendly working atmosphere.

- Maintains professional attitude.

- Maintains professional appearance.

- Accepts constructive criticism as evidenced by appropriate changes in behavior.

- Utilizes established channels of communication.

- Recognizes, accepts, and respects people as individuals.

title: Maternal Health Program Peer Recovery Specialist
description:
Position Summary: The Peer Recovery Specialist (CRPA) will provide strengths-based guidance and substance use recovery supports to clients to motivate and assist them with making a decision to engage in treatment. The Peer Recovery Specialist will help clients resolve barriers to achieving self-sufficiency. The Peer Recovery Specialist will work with women in the community to support our Maternal Health Program by providing recovery supports to pregnant and postpartum women with substance use disorder (SUD).



Responsibilities:


* Accompany clients to appointment, on transportation, and assist in reducing barriers to accessing care.
* Assist clients to identify goals, strengths, and personal interests helpful in recovery by providing didactic information.
* Motivate clients to attend treatment programs; find ways to help clients consider stopping/reducing using substances or reducing the risk associated with addictive behaviors.
* Utilize a trauma-informed approach to promote clients right to self-determination and provide services in a manner that emphasizes the women’s safety, respect and dignity.
* Participate in outreach to clients who are ambivalent about the assessment process, and discuss the process with them.
* Facilitate recovery oriented discussions with clients in the community.
* Become a Narcan responder and dispenser by attending training and becoming certified in dispensation of Narcan; train clients on the use of Narcan and provide kits and guidance on proper procedures of its use.
* Promote self-advocacy and identify community resources that support clients' goals and interests and share them with clients under the supervision of M-WRAP Social Worker.
* Performs other duties as assigned.


Qualifications:


* Associate Degree or certification equivalent required; Bachelor's Degree in a related field preferred
* 1 Year experience required.
* Experience working with pregnant or post-partum women highly preferred.
* **License Required: CRPA - NYS**
* **Certificate Required: CRPA - NYS**


Salary: $45,000/year



NADAP, Inc. is a multiservice non-profit agency dedicated to helping people with medical, behavioral health and social service needs to become self-sufficient. NADAP programs assist disadvantaged populations in New York City and Long Island. Our services include health insurance enrollment, assessment, care coordination, professional vocational training, job preparation, placement and case management. NADAP has a culturally diverse workforce and is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and supports diversity, equity, and inclusion. Visit us at www.nadap.org.

title: Assistant Planner
description:
Our Story
We make modern classics with character. We believe in true timelessness, the integrity of well-made clothes, and since our inception, great quality at a great price. That’s in our DNA.
But, we know it’s not only about the clothes—it’s about the *feeling* it gives the people who wear them*,* whether they’re confidently giving a presentation in a well-tailored suit; basking in long salty beach days in vibrant, colorful sun-soaked swimsuits, or joyfully re-discovering their favorite Rollneck sweater in their closet again and again, season after season.
And ultimately, it’s about helping our customers be the best, most authentic versions of themselves.
And *that’s* what we’re after, to inspire people’s lives and style.
Our dedication to Diversity, Equity, Belonging & Sustainability has been celebrated with industry recognition, reflecting our commitment to fostering an inclusive and sustainable workplace.
Overview:
As an Assistant Planner, you will support your manager in creating and executing sales and inventory financial plans at a department(s), style and SKU level. Assistant Planners are responsible for developing the skills to analyze and identify sales opportunities to provide risk mitigating recommendations.  

The Role + Purpose:
*PRESEASON** Create preseason sales, margin and inventory plans by department, class, style and color. Analyze previous quarter results; identify “missed sales” and growth drivers over prior year.
* Summarize the opportunity and risk of a product plan as it relates to trend and financial metrics: initial mark-up, average unit retail, average unit cost, net margin dollars/rate.
* Assist manager with development of the financial strategy associated with growth and diminish categories, based on current trend, historical findings or related categories.
 *IN SEASON** Provide daily and weekly updates on business as it relates to last forecast, identifying trends, and highlighting selling that exceeds or falls short of expectation.
* Prepare sales, margin and inventory forecast and assist manager in monthly OTB forecast meetings for current year; provide sales trend opportunity for future quarters, validate stock-to-sales relationships, maximize receipt flow to improve turn, reconcile receipts and suggest pricing strategies to drive profitability.
* Generate and manage style level weekly unit sales plans in season to inform total department sales expectation by week/month/quarter and identify styles contributing to a +/- to forecast.
* Assist manager to propose markdown and promotional strategies to maximize profitability on the life of an item or category; provide pricing and margin dollar gain/loss scenarios.
  

Qualifications:* Bachelor's degree
* Strong analytical, financial modeling and problem solving skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to manage multiple work streams/projects with tight deadlines.
* Strong technical aptitude, including advanced competency in Microsoft Excel and ability to quickly master new applications and systems

We welcome you to apply, even if you don't check all the boxes. Our passion is scouting life-long learners who are driven by curiosity, and who feel connected to our brands and share our desire to make an impact. We’re always seeking bright new talent who leverage their unique experiences to discover, grow and evolve with our teams.
Benefits + Perks* Health & Well-being - Eligible associates and family members receive medical, dental, prescription and vision insurance, family planning (fertility, adoption & surrogacy support), fitness discounts, medical travel and more.
* Associate Discount - We love our products just as much as you do! That’s why we offer a great associate discount across all of our brands (J.Crew, J.Crew Factory, and Madewell).
* Flex Fridays - In addition to our hybrid work model, we also close our office at 1:00 PM every Friday year-round.
* Community Impact - We support the communities where we live and work through our philanthropic efforts and the J.Crew Cares Program.
* Winter Break - In addition to our PTO package, J.Crew Group offers a winter break at the end of December to eligible full-time associates at the Home Office to provide time to refresh and recharge.


Note: Availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to work location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements.
Hourly Range: $25.48 - $29.33
At J.Crew Group (JCG) we aim to pay competitively for our company’s size and industry. The base salary offered will take into account internal equity and may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region of work premises, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. The base salary is just one component of J.Crew Group’s competitive total rewards strategy that also includes the opportunity for bonus, competitive benefits and perks.
One of our core focuses here at JCG is creating a community and culture that builds belonging. We are deeply committed to our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion efforts, and we warmly welcome job applicants of all backgrounds.  

JCG is proud to affirmatively provide equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or citizenship, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, legally protected physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected under applicable law.

title: Full-time Bell Attendant
description:
Tailored. Sophisticated. Unique. Located two blocks from Bryant Park, Refinery Hotel is a luxury hotel in Midtown Manhattan’s Garment District. While our home in the 1912 Colony Arcade building gives us a long history, our stylish loft rooms, acclaimed Parker & Quinn restaurant, and trendsetting Refinery Rooftop bar create a fashionable refuge for locals and cultured visitors in present-day New York.

Job Summary

As a Bell/Door Person you will be responsible for genuinely caring about our guest; assisting with arrivals and departures, making strong emotional connections by providing a guest tailored service at all times. To provide efficient, prompt and courteous assistance with luggage, rooming and guest relations to guests under the direction of the Director of Front Office, in line with The Refinery guidelines and service concepts.

Essential Functions

 Communicates effectively and genuinely with guests, team members and other departments.

 Maintains a friendly and caring demeanor at all times in a fast pace environment.

 Maintains a professional image at all times that falls within the hotel and company guidelines for appearance and dress.

 Demonstrates team work by co-operating and assisting colleagues as needed.

 Greets and welcomes every guest upon arrival.

 Becomes informed of events/functions in the hotel during shifts.

 Is able to find Tailored Unique and Sophisticated solutions. (Hugs the guest)

 Promotes hotel services, facilities and outlets, provide guest with information such as local attractions and directions, using The Refinery Report to increase guest satisfaction.

 Resolves guest complaints to the satisfaction of the customer by being guest centric, friendly and caring. Communicates to Management any problem, complaint or unhappy guest.

 Is intuitive to guest needs, anticipates needs in job performance, being proactive instead of reactive.

 Responds quickly to all guest requests in a caring friendly and professional manner, consistently follow up to ensure guest satisfaction that meets and exceed our services standards.

 Stays current with developments in the hotel by reviewing the communication log book each shift; updates log book for next shifts as well as communicate effectively the policies and

procedures to other team members of the hotel

 Has knowledge of and assist in all emergency procedures as required.

 Attends all mandatory meetings and training classes.

 Has knowledge of the names, titles and positions of key people within the hotel.

 Has knowledge of the hotel surrounded area, such a pharmacy, theaters, Public Transportation, Retail, and Restaurants etc.

 Completes all checklists as assigned.

 Rooms guest using the bellman script for informing guest about the hotel and our facilities

 Inspects guest room for order and adequate supplies and uniforms guests of room amenities

 Delivers faxes, messages, packages and flowers for guests, and undertakes any other requests to ensure their comfort

 Collects and returns outgoing guest laundry and dry cleaning

 Maintains the appearance of the hotel lobby

 Refills and replaces promotional material as needed

 Performs light cleaning in the lobby, corridors and entrances by picking up litter, emptying ashtrays and properly arranging furniture

 Observes any maintenance or housekeeping needs in corridors, lobby and guest rooms and reports needs to Front Office Supervisor

 Keeps luggage storage room clean and organized

 Has knowledge of all in-house and city functions which management provides in order to answer guest inquires quickly and knowledgeably

 Is aware of daily group arrivals and departures

 Ensures the efficient delivery and collection of group luggage

 Assists guests to bring luggage from room to hotel entrance

 Facilitates prompt check-out by assisting guests

 Stores and receives luggage when requested; issues completed claim checks to guests when storing luggage

Non Essential Functions

 Any and all other duties deemed necessary by a member of management.

 Be involved in departmental meetings and committees.

Requirements

 Strong customer service skills

 Guest centric oriented

 Knowledge about the area

 Attention to detail

 Planning and organizational ability

 Able to work nights, weekends and holidays when business needs dictates.

 Able to work in fast paced, stressful environment.

 Able to exert up to 50 lbs of force frequently.

 Ability to stand during the entire shift.

 Strong Oral communication skills

 Interpersonal skills

Physical Requirements

 Due to the cyclical nature of the hospitality industry, employees may be required to work varying schedules to reflect the business needs of the hotel.

 Considerable repetitive motion of hands and wrists as it relates to the use of computer keyboards is possible.

 Heavy work - Exerting up to 100 pounds of force occasionally, and /or 50 pounds of force frequently and/or up to 20 pounds of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects.

 Ability to stand during entire shift.

Other Requirements

 Maintain regular attendance in compliance with Refinery Hotel Standards, as required by scheduling, which will vary according to the needs of the hotel.

 Comply with Refinery Hotel Standards and regulations to encourage safe and efficient hotel operations. Must be able to understand and apply complex information, data, etc. from various sources to meet appropriate objectives.

 Must be able to cross-train in other hotel related areas.

 Must be able to maintain confidentiality of information.

 Must be able to show initiative, including anticipating guest or operational needs.

 Must be effective at listening to, understanding, and clarifying concerns raised by employees and guests.

 Must be able to multitask and prioritize departmental functions to meet deadlines.

 Attend all hotel required meetings and training's.

Education & Experience

 At least 1-2 years of experience in hospitality or a related field; at least 1 years Front Office experience

 Fluency in multiple languages a plus.

 Must be able to effectively communicate both verbally and written, with all level of employees and guests in an attentive, friendly, courteous and service oriented manner.

Grooming Requirements

Maintain high standards of personal appearance and grooming, which include wearing the proper uniform and hotel branded pin (specific standards available).

This job description is not intended to detail every aspect of your job or list every task you may perform. It is provided as a general overview of the responsibilities and skills required to do this job successfully.

Pay: From $19.00 per hour

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Hotel experience: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Operations Manager
description:
POSITION TITLE: Operations Manager

REPORTS TO: CEO/President

**Experience in Industrial Engineering is highly preferred.**

POSITION OBJECTIVE: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Operations Manager to join our team and lead our manufacturing operations to new heights of efficiency and productivity.

The Operations Manager will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of manufacturing, including pharmacy, blending, compression, packaging, and warehousing operations, equipment & facility maintenance, planning & scheduling, off-site OEM & CMO, operation optimization, efficiency, and output, inventory & supply chain management, ERP system & reports, budget management, personnel training & development, regulatory compliance etc. The successful candidate will play a critical role in building a cohesive culture, improving efficiency, supporting vigorous growth, and maximizing bottom line for the business.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Operational Leadership:

* Provide strategic direction and leadership to the manufacturing team to achieve production targets while maintaining the highest standards of quality and safety.
* Develop and implement operational procedures and best practices to optimize manufacturing processes and maximize efficiency.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement by identifying areas for enhancement and implementing solutions to drive operational excellence.
* Production, planning and prioritization for all channels. Achieve production targets through coaching and direction provided to Planner/Scheduler.

2. Machine Performance Optimization:

* Oversee the performance of blending, compression, bottling, and blister machines, ensuring they operate at maximum efficiency and output.
* Implement preventive maintenance programs to minimize downtime and maximize machine uptime and reliability. Support using non-prime manufacturing hours for machine maintenance.
* Troubleshoot equipment issues and coordinate with maintenance and engineering teams to promptly address any mechanical or technical issues. Build a robust maintenance and engineering team to support the company’s machine-driven manufacturing philosophy. Maintain a critical spare parts inventory for key machineries to minimize downtime. Build an in-house machine shop to support fabrication of parts and machine repairs.
* Develop a master plan to maintain and replace each piece of equipment over its life cycle to assure that it is performing at peak level at all times.

3. Quality Assurance and Regulatory Compliance:

* Ensure compliance with FDA regulations, cGMP standards, and company quality control procedures.
* Implement quality assurance measures to guarantee the integrity and purity of our pharmaceutical products.
* Facilitate regular audits and inspections to identify and resolve any compliance issues or deviations.

4. Inventory and Supply Chain Management:

* Coordinate with procurement and supply chain teams to optimize inventory levels and ensure timely availability of raw materials and components.
* Implement inventory control measures to minimize waste and reduce carrying costs.
* Collaborate with vendors and suppliers to satisfy required specifications, negotiate favorable terms and improve supply chain efficiency.

5. Team Development and Training:

* Recruit, train, and develop manufacturing personnel to build a highly skilled and motivated team.
* Provide coaching and mentorship to employees to foster professional growth and career advancement.
* Promote a culture of safety awareness and adherence to standard operating procedures.

6. Budget Management:

* Develop and manage the manufacturing budget, ensuring resources are allocated efficiently to meet production targets.
* Identify cost-saving opportunities and implement strategies to optimize manufacturing expenditures.
* Monitor expenses and financial performance metrics to track budget adherence and identify variances.

7. ERP System:

* Responsible for ERP system maintenance, upgrades, and training.
* Fully utilize all available modules to optimize and maximize manufacturing operations.
* Develop, improvement, and maintain all necessary reports to provide in-depth analysis on operational data to provide recommendations and solutions for continued improvement.

8. Collaboration and Communication:

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including commercial, R&D, procurement, outsourcing, quality control, and regulatory affairs, to support new product launches and process improvements.
* Communicate regularly with senior management to provide updates on manufacturing performance, challenges, and opportunities.
* Foster a culture of open communication and teamwork to achieve common goals and objectives.

QUALIFICATIONS:

* Bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering, manufacturing, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in manufacturing management, preferably in the OTC pharmaceutical industry.
* Proven track record of success in optimizing manufacturing processes and driving operational efficiency improvements.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate teams to achieve excellence.
* In-depth knowledge of FDA regulations, cGMP standards, and quality assurance principles.
* Experience with Lean Six Sigma methodologies and continuous improvement initiatives.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on data-driven decision-making.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate cross-functionally and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
* Demonstrated proficiency in budget management and resource allocation.
* Certifications in manufacturing management or quality assurance (e.g., CPIM, CQE) are a plus.

BENEFITS:

* Competitive salary, comprehensive benefits and incentive package
* Opportunity for professional growth and advancement
* Dynamic and collaborative work environment
* Commitment to employee development and training
* Health and wellness programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Ability to Relocate:

* Deer Park, NY 11729: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Real Estate Agent Partner
description:
### **Summary**

### **Join The Melnikoff Real Estate Experience as a Real Estate Agent Partner**


Become a key member of our dynamic team dedicated to providing exceptional service to our clients. Located at **1700 Route 23, Wayne, USA, 07470**, we seek motivated and enthusiastic individuals with a passion for real estate and a desire to grow their careers. As a Real Estate Agent Partner, you will flourish in a collaborative setting, receive ongoing training, and leverage our extensive network to achieve your professional goals. If you are driven, customer-focused, and ready to make a meaningful impact, we want to connect with you!

### **Responsibilities**

* **Assist clients** in buying, selling, and renting properties, ensuring a seamless and positive experience.
* **Conduct market research** to stay updated on property values, trends, and competitive listings.
* **Prepare and present** detailed property listings, including high-quality photos and accurate descriptions.
* **Negotiate contracts** and agreements, ensuring favorable terms for clients while maintaining compliance with legal standards.
* **Coordinate property showings** and open houses, providing potential buyers with comprehensive information and tours.
* **Build and maintain relationships** with clients, industry professionals, and local communities to generate leads and referrals.
* **Utilize CRM software** to manage client interactions, track progress, and follow up on leads efficiently.

### **Qualifications**

* **Valid Real Estate License** in the state of New Jersey
* **Minimum 2 years of experience** in real estate sales or a related field
* **Proven track record** of successful real estate transactions
* **Strong knowledge** of local real estate market trends and regulations
* **Excellent communication and negotiation skills**

* **Ability to work independently** and as part of a team

* **Strong organizational skills** and attention to detail
* **Reliable transportation** and willingness to travel within the service area
* **Flexibility to work evenings and weekends** as needed
* **Bachelor’s degree** in Business, Real Estate, or a related field is preferred

### **About-our-team**


At The Melnikoff Real Estate Experience, we strive to provide our clients with the highest level of service. We do this through superior technology that maximizes the reach of our efforts, teamwork & supportive collaboration, deliberately-formed positive habits, and a culture of exceptional performance. We show up daily with a smile and a positive attitude toward breaking previous records. Our clients realize success because we invest in our people. When committed individuals have the education, tools, and support they need to thrive, excellence is achieved. Join us and get ready to be the best version of yourself.

* To ensure that schedule, cost, safety, and quality objectives are met by:
	+ Meeting or exceeding the project schedule
	+ Ensuring that adequate subcontractor manpower is on-site to support the project
	+ Communicating with Subcontractors, Project Managers, Design Professionals, and Owners to proactively identify schedule obstacles and resolve those obstacles before they affect the project
	+ Effectively managing field general conditions (dumpsters, small tools, etc.)
	+ Accurately documenting all T&M ticket work on a daily basis and effectively communicating with PM to promptly issue change orders or resolve contract disputes
	+ Drafting site management plan (laydown, housekeeping, etc.) and enforcing the plan
	+ Ensuring proper housekeeping at minimal cost to BCC or Owner
	+ Participating in safety audits per Operations Group goals
	+ Ensuring shutdown plans, lift plans, etc. are utilized per BCC guidelines
	+ Inspecting work installation for adherence to plans and specifications
	+ Understanding the status of submittals
	+ Using Procore RFI's (Request for information) as necessary to clarify constructability issues
* Develop a positive relationship with customers that are consistent with project objectives and directives.
* Participate in the monthly invoice approval process for subcontractors
* Fulfill daily project-related tasks thoroughly and efficiently
* Identify and resolve all potential problems and/or discrepancies contained in the contract documents
* Responsible for field coordination not only between trades but including owner or owner resources.
* Responsible for ensuring the accuracy of surveys and layout.
* Pharmaceutical experience a plus

**We Provide:**

title: PROJECT EXECUTIVE
description:
**Salary Range: Depending on skillset and experience, starting at $135k +**  

Bancroft Construction is looking for a full-time Project Executive. This positionperforms responsibilities in seven primary roles: Internal Project Team Support, Operational Oversight, Risk Management, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Business Development, and Culture. These seven roles are designed to support Bancroft’s commitment to success in External Relations, Growth, Customer Satisfaction, Operational Excellence, and Internal Harmony.
To ensure the project's success, Project Executives are required to demonstrate flexibility and fluidity when performing the position's responsibilities based on current and future circumstances related to any aspect of the project.


**Responsibilities:**


**Internal Project Team Support**

* Provide support and leadership among multiple project teams to ensure they have the appropriate resources to manage the job successfully and are meeting the Client’s expectations.
* Mentor project teams by identifying key learnings during the project and opportunities for both team and individual development.


**Operational Oversight**

* Engage and ensure that components of the internal systems, processes, and controls (Bancroft Way) are consistently and effectively executed across the project lifespan.
* Provide ongoing coaching to the Project Team or company based on Customer feedback to ensure positive project experiences.

**Risk Management**

* Proactively collaborate with the Project Team to identify potential risks (e.g., cost, safety, quality, schedule), roadblocks, and strategies to mitigate risk.
* Ensure the for the Owner’s sensitive or high-risk areas.

**Customer Relationship Management (CRM)**

  

* Provide a direct link/liaison between Bancroft Project Teams and Executive level owner representatives so that communication between companies/parties is clear, concise, timely, and honest.
* Establish project goals in relationship to but not limited to success factors, schedule, budget, scope, safety, challenges, and execution of various plans.
* Develop a solid Customer Relationship with the owner, design team, and other stakeholders that aligns both within and outside of the project parameters.
* Support Bancroft’s Mission and Vision by participating in professional opportunities (Thought Leadership) where expertise can be shared with internal and external stakeholders.

**Business Development**

* Convert your network into projects.
* Develop existing and new relationships with Bancroft personnel and the Client, AEs, Consultants, Subcontractors, Vendors, and Influencers throughout the project’s duration to identify future projects and opportunities.
* Participate in industry associations to develop connections and foster new relationships.
* Participate in work acquisition efforts by assisting with proposals and presentation strategies, content development, and working with estimating. Assist with contract negotiation and execution.

**Culture**

* Embody and promote Bancroft’s culture to all internal and external stakeholders.

**Qualifications:**

* Conflict resolution skills.
* Working knowledge of contract methods.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and negotiation skills.
* Ability to communicate (orally and in writing) in a professional manner when dealing with employees, vendors, clients, and owners.
* Willingness to travel.
* Excellent organizational, planning, and prioritization skills.
* Excellent interpersonal skills.
* Competent computer skills to perform essential functions listed above.

**Education/Experience:**

* A Bachelor of Science Degree in Construction, Business, or Engineering is preferred, but experience may be considered in lieu of.
* Fifteen years plus of practical experience in the construction industry, with five or more years experience in project management, estimating, or design required.
* Experience in all phases of construction.
* Experience in multiple construction market sectors.

 **We Provide:**

* Competitive Base Salary
* Medical *\\*no waiting period*
* Dental/Vision
* Short Term Disability/Life Insurance
* Paid Time Off (PTO)/Paid Holidays
* 401k Plan & Company Match
* Employee Assistance Program
* Training & Education
* Employee Appreciation Program
* Voluntary Long Term Care Insurance

***Note to Recruiters, Placement Agencies, and Similar Organizations****: Bancroft does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our jobs alias, website, or to any Bancroft employee. Bancroft will not pay fees to any third-party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered Bancroft's property and will be processed accordingly.*

title: Overnight Security Specialist (Part Time)
description:
**Location & Shifts Available:*** **PT Overnights**
* **West Orange, NJ**

**Ideal candidate for this role**:


The ideal candidate for this role is someone with Security experience and has knowledge of security systems and practices. A Security Specialist who enjoys meeting new people and creating a welcoming environment, is a plus!

**Rewards:**

* Paid time off
* Medical/Vision benefits
* Retirement Benefits
* Referral bonuses
* Learning opportunities

**Position Description:**


The purpose of the Security Specialist position is to foster the safety of the building by handling access control by monitoring and documenting the flow of incoming and outgoing residents, visitors, guests and building activities or building emergencies. The prospective candidate is also responsible for handling resident requests and promoting a welcoming environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Pleasant and professional demeanor: ability to graciously interact with residents, guests, building vendors, and building management.
* Track all package deliveries, daily activities using building software program.
* Log & inform residents of incoming visitors & direct visitors.
* Maintain access control and review cameras to ensure the safety of the residents.
* Manage administrative requests on behalf of Property Managers.
* Independently navigate and troubleshoot unpredictable situations that may arise including maintenance issues.

**Requirements:**

* High School Diploma
* SORA Certification
* Basic computer literacy skills and talent for technology (i.e. handheld radios, telephones, computers, etc)..
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Able to multi-task and good time-management.
* Weekend and evening availability.
* Well-groomed, professional appearance.
* Ability to stand or sit for the duration of the assigned shift, lift, push and pull at least 30 lbs.
* Ability to work in all weather conditions.
* Adhere to **APC** location site **Standard Operating Procedure (SOP).**

**Preferred Experience:**

* 1 year of office/administrative experience.
* 1 year of high-end residential or hotel experience as Bellman, Porter, Door Attendant, Greeter, Server, Host.
* Knowledge of Carson and/or BuildingLink software.

**Who is APC?**


APC is a full-service hospitality company, providing Front Desk Concierge, Security, Valet Parking, Shuttle and Door Greeter services for residential buildings, healthcare facilities & corporate centers. If you are someone who likes making lasting connections or even looking to “do something different,” we’d love to hear from you! Here at APC we value team building and encourage success by offering room for growth and often promoting from within.

**Contact us:**

* Call: (973) 857-2008 x103 (If no one is available to take the call, please leave a message)


APC is an equal opportunity employer. APC does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.
